name: New York State Museum
reviews: It is absolutely stunning museum with so much history in it. I am amazed with all the exhibitions and details that you can find there. Whole history of New York , old trains , cars , fire trucks , centuries of cultural development all in one place. Highly recommend for the whole family or to anyone really- true highlight of the Albany City . Best of all - it’s free of charge ( donation is appreciated). 5 stars

From childhood to adulthood and across many states this museum has remained a favorite of mine.  The main floor exhibits have always been such a great way to learn about the NY environment and history.  I have always loved the adirondack displays and also the parts about metro life.  The Native American area is amazing.  This museum continues to bring learning to life and remind me of my roots a I have lived in Baltimore MD for almost 20 years now. The love of it has moved on to my children and we will continue to visit in the future.

Lots of exhibits to see. Nicely organized. Poignant 9/11 exhibit. Excellent local animal exhibit as well as locally discovered mastodon and whale skeletons. Minerals and NYC historical sections also interesting.
Gem show! Had a lot of fun. Harlem Display is a great educational tool. Just a relaxing place to be on a lazy Sunday. Good parking. And the Carousel!!!

So we love it. It's a beautiful museum really clean awesome things to look at and explore. Only concern is my son is almost 5 I'm not sure how kid friendly it is. There is a kids part but it's pretty small

name: New York State Capitol
address: State St. and, Washington Ave, Albany, NY 12224, USA
reviews: If you’re visiting the area, it’s well worth checking out the capitol building. The craftsmanship and history of this building is pretty amazing. Photographs don’t do it justice. You need to see this with your own eyes. The detail in the stone carvings is a must see. The concourse that runs below the area is also pretty cool. You can stop in Logan’s and get a delicious sandwich while you’re there.

Lots of amazing details went into the capitol building. It is a good architectural visit and see how the various architects created their vision over the very long time it took to build the capitol. Do the guided tour and also do the self-tour to get the most out of your visit there. There are so many things to look at and discover, plan to be there for at least 4 hours to discover as much as possible.

How to rate this place? It holds some of the most courageous, dedicated, selfless people... But then it also holds some of the most disgusting, corrupt, and greedy.

 There is a cool museum inside though, and the Million Dollar Staircase is impressive.

Beautiful historic place where State legislators come together to create legislation that governs our ways of life and social construct. It's an incredibly breathtaking architectural place worth visiting.

We went on a weekday tour. It was just after a large High School group, and the guide took care to avoid them and the noise that came with them. Our group was just a few folks, so made for a very relaxed and quiet experience that encouraged observation and learning. We saw a good portion of the building and also lingered afterward to poke into a few spots we passed earlier for a closer look. There are lots of inconsistencies in the story of the Capitol's construction that prompt questions these days. Such as, how is it possible to be 8 million dollars over budget (total spent $12mil) after spending the initial 4mil, before the governor "notices"? Why did nobody "notice" after the project was $1mil over budget? How is it possible to lose a huge portion of historical records in a fire which specifically targeted the library, with a single victim who did not make it out? Weren't there fire safety precautions in place in case of such event? Was the fire an accident? How can you leave just a few stone carving elements unfinished, becoming an instant eye sore and looking embarrassing in the most important Chambers of the building, while the carvings on the staircases are finished? How can you make ceiling decoration out of paper when you know the roof leaks and you've got buckets on the floor to catch the water? Why install giant non-working fireplaces, when you know you need to heat the building in winter, so could use real working ones? There are still lots of questions to ponder and research, and the tour is just the beginning.

name: USS SLATER
reviews: John was our tour guide! Very knowledgeable and genuinely answered all of our questions enthusiastically. It truly is a hidden gem located in the heart of Downtown Albany : only 2 of these ships remain in the world, the one in Albany being the only one afloat, the other one in Galveston being on land. It felt like we were back in 1945 while touring this museum. I hope they keep the museum as it is as it represents an important part of our history.

Phenomenal vessel, important ongoing mission, could not be a more dedicated group to care for her. Amazing to see her further restoration since my visit 17 years ago. Here are some shots from 2003. Keep up the great work. Long live Destroyer Escort USS Slater.

This was a really cool land (or rather water) mark when we saw it. The tours were informative, captivating and well-incorporated the restored elements of the ship. Some of the restorations are really impressive - the size of the guns on top are quite shocking in-person. Our guide was friendly and went above and beyond to answer our questions after the tour was done. This was a really cool element of our trip to Albany.

Awesome piece of history. The last floating destroyer in its class. Terrific guided visit that show the rough leaving quarter on board and the state of the art technology for ww2. Guides are passionate. The tour is fast pace and enjoyable and brings tons of interesting anecdotes. Definitively a good visit!

Visited Albany to see friend from Detroit. It’s Friday afternoon and tour was conducted in small group. I love history and knew bit about WW2. However, It was first time I got to know the life of Sailors inside the ship during the war. Our guide was excellent and we learned so much. I’m not sure how I felt.... it was hard to imagine what young people went through... Must have been very steep learning environment for lots of them. Tour is  educational and also you get to relax by the riverside. 
Free parking and easy access to the building. 
Donations will keep going this great piece of history and education. Well recommended. :)

name: Albany Pine Bush Preserve
address: 195 New Karner Rd #1, Albany, NY 12205, USA
reviews: The discovery center is great. 4 stars because it's kind of small but it's interesting and educational. They also have a small outdoor area to play and have separate rooms for different activities that they organize for children. Plus it's free!

5 yr old granddaughter on break from school. Thought we'd be there a very short time. Almost 2 hours later we left after promising her we'd return another time. Staff wonderful, so much to do and see inside the building.
Beautiful place stop to have a photo shoot with the family. Fall colors setting in on the leaves in the trees. Just absolutely gorgeous!!

We went on a short nature walk it was my husband's cousin his two boys and myself we really had fun it was nice outside and it was nice to walk the trails and get some fresh air will definitely go again if I'm in the area

Such an amazing place. Between the rare ecology and animal species and the miles and miles of trail that truly feel like wilderness this is an extremely special place. 
Sad to hear that it used to be much larger than it is nowadays...

name: Dutch Apple Cruises & Tours
address: Broadway and, Quay St, Albany, NY 12202, USA
reviews: A cool way to spend a hot afternoon. Nice ocean and river breezes provide relief from the heat.  However you only get the breeze going one way on the river. This day when we were coming back there was no breeze and it was very hot.  The historian, Pat provided interesting stories along the way. My wish was that the cruise could have been longer.
An Amazing experience!! I live in the city, and being able to go on a cruise like that was really fun. There are food onboard as well as drinks. Absolutely recommend it for others.

Q103 Pirate Cruise of 2012--- We were invited to a pirate themed cruise on the Hudson, which turned out to be pretty amazing. Games, drinks, new friends, and more down and back! I am not sure if they do these anymore, but it is worth looking into!

Relaxing boat ride with a bar in the back of the middle level. Shade for all three levels, great PA system for the tour guide. Wish the ride was more scenic than the industrial scenery of Albany. Once we got past this, it was great to see the old mansions and our tour guide spotted a bald eagle in the trees bordering the Hudson.

Very informative cruise....we learned a bit about the history of Albany and got some pictures of American eagles....at 20 bucks each it was good value. The bar had a good selection and the staff was friendly.

name: Capital Holiday Lights
reviews: It is a great place to spend time with friends. I go there on field trips each year before Winter break. There are a lot of different lights to display. That even have light up Christmas trees. There are polar bears displayed. There is also an elephant helping santa load the sleigh.

It was our first time here we will be going every year the day after Christmas as a tradition from now on. The lights were beautiful everything is really well done... The hot chocolate and the crafts inside are awesome also.

It's a fun family car ride with lights where even my littlest one couldn't get enough lights. The vendors are local and have been the staple of a good market to check out after the lights. Now a family tradition when we are visiting home for the holidays.

This was one of the best light shows I've ever seen. It's awesome because the kids can get out of their car seats as you slowly idle around what seems like miles of roads and light displays. many of displays are animated and there's always a new surprise around every corner. this was the first year we went, but we plan to make this a yearly family tradition. The line can be quite long so make sure you bring some entertainment for the kids while you wait. it took us about two and a half hours from the time we arrived until the time we had completed the entire circuit.

Every year the park does an excellent job lighting up the park with beautiful and enjoyable holiday lights. It is great walking through the park at night or driving your car through or running. Our son lives across from the park and the lights are enjoyable from his apartment. Albany does a great job carrying for their parks in general.

name: Albany Institute of History & Art
reviews: Great smaller museum. We've been to many events: First Friday free (night hours), Schuyler Sisters (best exhibit yet), local Victorian wedding dresses exhibit, Hudson River School exhibit, permanent mummies and ancient Egyptian and many others. Lots of kid activities accompany each visit. Snack bar great. We love this museum.

I was expecting this to be a great museum, I didn't realize how great it would be.  I was blown away by the Hudson River School gallery, totally awestruck.  My kids loved the dioramas.  Mr wife liked the art made from reused materials, like acorns and pistachio shells and tea bags.  Very cool, strongly recommended.

Only one floor was open when I went recently, as exhibitions were being swapped out in the other, but there was still plenty to see (and the admission price was halved due to there being the one less floor) anyhow.

The flow of the place lends itself well to easy meandering, the staff is very friendly and helpful and the exhibits themselves are well-curated.

And at only $10/person for adults, it’d be worth coming a few times a year.

This place is one of the most unsung wonderful places in the city of Albany. It's so well laid out. Very handicap friendly parking and display access. 3 floors of beautiful art work and the history behind many of the pieces is detailed and well written. The Jewel of this summer at the institute is the display of the Hudson River school artists. Painting after wonderful painting presented with an instructive guide provided by the museum, that tells you exactly what each picture is of and who it's by. I found this incredibly helpful. There Egyptian area was surprising. It's nice to know that one doesn't have to go to New York to see an incredible and detailed display on ancient Egyptian culture.
Come early and plan to spend several hours here. There is a gift shop,of course and a snack bar  that has limited beverages and Rich deserts. But a little thin on healthy snacks and food items. There are displays after interesting displays and one day doesn't seem like enough time to spend at such a rich and enlightening space.

While quite small, the quality of exhibits was quite high, especially considering the size of Albany.  The Louvre it is not, but well worth a trip! The docent at Reception was very knowledgeable about the exhibits and super nice. Bonus, they have their own parking lot around back so you don't have to fight the dreaded downtown Albany parking situation!

name: Ten Broeck Mansion
address: 9 Ten Broeck Pl, Albany, NY 12210, USA
reviews: A National Treasure in the Heart of Albany this Amazing landmark mansion is an absolute delight! The gardens are open year round offering a beautiful green space for the urban surround.  Magnificent views during fall and winter.  The Board members are above and beyond passionately committed to the mansion and their preservation of it. A worthwhile place to endow your support.
A lovely secret garden hidden in the middle of downtown Albany. There was no one else there for the better part of an hour. Plenty of space to lounge about, surrounded by greenery.
The tour guide is a little short but I  understand it is a volunteer place beautiful place lots of history
Went to see "The Ideal Husband", and it was wonderful! We stayed on the first floor, the mansion was beautiful, and the actors were great - all around fantastic.
this is a true hidden gem of Albany. There is something to see here no matter the season - from Santa to flower blossoms to fall foliage.

name: Far Shot Albany - Axe Throwing/Archery/Knife Throwing
address: 69 N Pearl St, Albany, NY 12207, USA
reviews:
My husband and I went for a little date night and had the best time ! Our coach was Tom and he helped make the evening even better! He not only taught us how to throw safely but how to progress each time. He also spiced it up turning into a game really adding to the fun. 
Whether you are doing a date night, a friend's night out or a party we HIGHLY suggest!! We also found out they have leagues which is some thing we are definitely looking into! 
Guys if you are not going here you are missing out 5/5 HIGHLY RECOMMEND ♥️

This place was so great! I went there with my Mom and friend and we had a blast. None of us knew how to throw knives or axes before but our instructor Erick did a really good job. He's an excellent teacher and helped us to improve our technique. He was also very accommodating with scheduling our time.

It's a really fun activity and I would definitely go back. 10/10 would recommend
A unique place to go to burn some energy! Jess was an awesome teacher for sure. Great memories created and a cool place to tell your friends about!!

FANTASTIC place to go. Incredibly fun, both for kids and adults, safety is the #1 priority, nobody was injured. Axe throwing is very fun and competitive. Don't worry about not being good at it or thinking it'll be heavy, a couple practice throws and the right technique, you'll do great, especially with an instructor like Ashley/Axeley. Can't wait to go back.

This place was so much fun! I can't remember our coaches name, but she definitely helped make the experience even better. She gave us tips and walked us through how to properly and safely throw axes along with hitting the bullseye. We will definitely be going back some time soon!

name: Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception
reviews: Great place to hear a sacred music concert. Architecture and design is stunning.
Beautiful.  Free admission.  A sacred place right next to our infamous Governor's mansion and mere steps from the NYS museum.  Stop by.  All are welcome.

Beautiful place from inside and outside! It's free and you can take your time. When there's no session parking it's free and very central from other sightseens. I recommend to go to the museum next to the church first, because it closes at 5 and it's worth it!
Truly not only Majestic but also humble in accessibility always open to the public , welcoming and Peaceful oasis in the heart of Albany.  A real treasure!!

Great worship place. The head priest have a gifted tongue, he make the bible come to life when he reads the gospel and delivers homily. A must go to place, very historic and great architectural arches

name: Discover Albany Visitors Center
reviews: Excellent location, exhibits, and helpful and knowledgeable people. Great background for the settlement and development of this area
Fun time spent with my daughter learning about planets and stars

Helpful staff provided great tips on how to spend a day in downtown Albany and offered pointers on walking tour highlights. In addition to maps and brochures, the information centre has a surprisingly large exhibition on the history of Albany.
Very helpful and friendly, especially Patti, who I dealt with :)
Great little visitors bureau and free museum.

name: Lincoln Park
reviews: Love this park.  My Buddy 🐕and I walk there all the time.  Always clean and I feel safe there.
Great place to relax away from the hustle and bustle of Albany NY. I was a bbn to knock down 2000 steps in this beauty. Very nice place to walk your dog or just lay back and reflect on the day.

Love the pool, the space for the kids and adults to play. Love the playground, specially in the summer when the sprinkler are on.. Lincoln park is a very clean and nice place to have a great family time..
Love this Park You better visit it before it disappears. The city of Albany is trying to get rid of it.
Great place to work 10 **********

name: Irish American Heritage Museum
reviews: I would like to have more time to spend here! They are doing some really great stuff with concerts and other events!

First time there. Friendly and outgoing people. Wonderful time there. Many items to buy and lots of books with Irish history 
I will be back.
A great place to learn about Irish history and local Albany facts. We parked right outside the door and spent over an hour inside.
A fabulous little place! Great building!
Interesting about the Irish in Albany and about Albany itself. Very knowledgeable staff.

name: Six Mile Waterworks Park
reviews: The food is delicious, especially the chicken and lamb. Love the chickpea appetizer as well. The service is great. They always get our order right and they are super friendly.
Great little oasis within a busy area.  Easy to get to,  great fishing spot for kids or inexperienced.  Nice long paved walking and/or biking path.
Nice and relaxing place to take photos. I have even seen people ice fish when it is colder out.
Nice little park with few swings and a beautiful pond.  There is a picnic area but its not maintained properly.

This little spot has been a favorite of mine since I was a kid. For me, it's just the solitude and catching sunsets. But for everyone else, it's got a few nice trails around the reservoir, a bunch of public bbq grills and picnic table, a decent playground area for kids. It's a nice respite from the hustle around it, and it connects to trails into the Pine Bush as well.

name: New York State Executive Mansion
reviews: Fun and educational
Heard it's cool but it's almost impossible to get in there. Doesn't seem like it's the people's house at all. But my taxes pay for it.
The average public is not allowed there.
Nice looking building
Muy cierto lo que dice el caballero , es un lugar lleno de paz y tranquilidad. Wow, les recomiendo tambien

name: The Children's Museum of Science and Technology
reviews: Hello Katlean is very friendly and accommodating. But I was informed by the day manager adults must be accommodate by a children. It a rules . That I was not offended by . But very disappointed to explore and recommend this Museum. Public to pay 8.00 for cost. While you where enjoy your day. It should be posted on site. Parents did not look offend by present. I even laugh with another mom and boys getting in canoes. Smile laughter. I am confidant mom and grandchildren 7. But mine grew up for this ages group. Toddlers and kindergartners age group perfect. Katlean 10 plus . you have very polite and special.
You can play with everything here! It's so hands on and amazing for kids. Learning never stop nor does the fun! I had more fun than my own kids did!

Nice children's museum, perfect for under age 10 and good for about 2 1/2 hours if you help your children to interact with some of the exhibits. If you just let your kids run through you will be done in half that time. Museum looks a bit worn and the animal area was about 3/4 full and the glass really needed cleaning. Friendly staff and reasonable price.

The children's museum is a very nice place to bring your child between the age of 2 + 9. They have a lot of Hands-On activities and the staff there are very pleasant. You could probably get there through the whole place with your children in an hour and a half.
While all ages can appreciate it, its geared about 10 to 14 year olds. Many exhibits have pretty detailed reading at that age level. Lots of room and not that noisy even on Saturday

name: Buckingham Lake Park
reviews:
Beautiful park. Quiet, not too many people and scenic. The lake is very nice and has a couple of fountains as well. You will see a family of geese chilling somewhere which is awesome. There is also a playground if you have kids that you want to bring to this park.

Overall, the park isn’t all that big but has everything you could ask for from a park. A nice trail, trees, lake, quiet atmosphere, animals, and parking area. If you’re in the Albany area, definitely check this park out. I’ll definitely be back if I’m in the area.

I have been going here since I was a little boy. My grandparents lived two houses in from the pond/lake on Lenox Ave. I remember fishing with my grandpa, skating in the winter, and now I take my kids here. The new playground is nice and the picnic tables are good for bringing a lunch. Glad to have a place like this to come to.
Very nice park and walking paths. Awesome new playground.  Calling it a Lake is a pretty big stretch . It is a man made pond.

Buckingham is great for running or exploring. I fish in the pond and I find that it has ample fish population to keep me busy. The recently updated playground is very nice and has multiple levels of size for all ages.
We love it here. It's got great equipment on the playground for the kids and a nice walking trail along the pond.

name: American Italian Heritage Museum
reviews: Love the intimate atmosphere ! The curator  had a great knowledge of the history of Italian immigrants. A must-see for all Italian immigrants stopping by in Albany. It truly is a gem that immigrants can relate to their own life and experiences. Also very informative.
Fantasticly preserved heritage of Italian-American heritage and of the Albany area.
Interesting photos and memorabilia.  Fun Italian classes.
Awesome museum and presentations!
Great location 👍 Lots of valuable information.

name: The Crossings of Colonie
address: 580 Albany Shaker Rd, Loudonville, NY 12211, USA
reviews: Such a beautiful well maintained park. The trails, park for everyone of all ages, lawn area for frisbee and picnics and of course the large gazebo and the gorgeous pond of fish. This park is truly a surreal and great place to relax and hangout for everyone in the community. I do some of my photography shoots here and it’s just so beautiful. My cousin had his wedding here and I photographed it for them and the turnout was truly amazing. Love the Crossings!!

This is one of my favorite spots, all year around, to visit in the greater Capital District! Its great for outdoors parties, community events, casual walking, or even avid runners! Its beautiful forest trails and gorgeous pond full of fish and fowls! 

Definitely worth a trip to enjoy a little walk or even a picnic with the family!
Park is really nice with a great play area for kids and really nice walking tracks. Just the pond with ducks and fishes is too dirty. They need a way to clean that water.
Nice park to enjoy with your family and friends. Beautiful and serene location in the midst of a bustling city. A must visit location.
It is a great place to go and walk or watch ducks and fish.  I love taking my dog for walk there.

name: Historic Cherry Hill
address: 523 S Pearl St, Albany, NY 12202, USA
reviews: Has a great annual Albany History Fair in Spring and halloween mystery tour in Fall. Besides the garden, there is a hidden lawn that is great for spring picnics.  Interior has beautiful wallpaper and you might leave and decide that you need wallpaper in your house.
the volunteers do such a good job here and they're always trying to think of new, creative ways to make the site hip and fun.
Great museum. Beautiful exposition.
This is a great historic house museum. Friendly and knowledgeable staff, great stories and cool collections. Check it out!
It is beautiful inside

name: Shaker Heritage Society
address: 25 Meeting House Rd, Albany, NY 12211, USA
reviews:
I give this high marks for the passionate volunteers who work at this sweet underfunded museum.  

It would behoove the City of Albany to caretake the buildings they have left to rot, shame on them.  I think due to the ramshackle quality of the surroundings buildings many tourists  in the area who want to visit  a Shakers community choose instead to visit the Hancock Shaker Village , a living history museum preserved for generations.  The Shaker story is of high interest and tourists want to learn about this communal lifestyle that has few remaining communities.  

I am glad I was able to meet this small but enthusiastic group of knowledgeable and avid Shaker history buffs.

My mom Worked there when I was a child
At Ann Lee Nursing home up till the day the moved all the resident's to the New Albany County Nursing home.
Great memories going to work with her at both places.
The Building is amazing just sad to see it left the way it is 
But the grounds are amazingly kept and it's beautiful there.
Ghost Hunter's may like to check it out.
Got some good pics during my day trip.
Also visit Ann Lee's Grave. As well as the pond. 
You will enjoy it.
But I love it so much for the memory of my mom and I working her 3 pm to 11 pm shifts.
Miss those days and her.
Nice educational tour, custodian great, well organized
Great place great people

I know the volunteers her do their vrry best operating this site,  but it is a shame Albany doesn't provide them with adequate budget to maintain the place as it should be. This is the original Shaker site in America and the founder, Ann Lee is buried here. A place of such historic importance deserves far better preservation than this one is getting. Every other Shaker village in the country has a private foundation to see to its upkeep, but this one is owned by the city of Albany and it is starved for the funds it needs. I love the place and visit it frequently, but it is heart-breaking to see many of the buildings needing repair. It would be nice if the volunteers would organize some "Hands to work, hearts to God" days, when people from the community could come together to apply fresh paint, make some simple repairs, and so forth. But, back to the review--the museum and gift shop are very good. The orchard and cemetery are worth the short walk, the critters in the barn are fun, and the herb garden is very well maintained. They have a holiday craft fair coming up that lasts four weeks, has some great craft item, at very good prices, which I recommend highly. The staff are friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful.

name: Funplex Funpark
address: 589 Columbia Turnpike, East Greenbush, NY 12061, USA
reviews:
A nice little getaway for a few hours that’s fun and genuine. Alison and Scott, the owners, are exceptionally nice, and if you have any issue they are more than happy to give you excellent customer service. There’s so much to do, and my family loved visiting and look forward to coming back!

I recommend the go karting, rock climbing, and mini golfing, and if you have little kids then the mini go karts look really fun!

This is a great place for the entire family and includes go-karts, a batting cage, a rock climbing wall, a bungee jumping trampoline, a miniature golf course, bounce house, a motorboat course, a mini go-kart course and the water balloon and also a snack concession stand and there are also multiple other little things to do. This place is a great place to host a birthday party provided it's during the season. The only thing that this place could improve is its cleanliness and maintenance which is why I'm only giving it 4 stars. There was puddles of water in the bounce house and other places and it could have been maintained a little bit better

Certainly not what we were expected. Half of the attractions are in need of maintenance. Our kids wanted to use the bounce house, after we paid for them to go in. They did one round through and stated they did not feel safe because there were so many holes. Go carts were fun, but on a very tiny track. Will not be returning any time soon. Experience was not worth the $30 spent.

Great place for an inexpensive kids party!  Hosted our son's 3rd birthday here last week and everyone had a great time.  The bounce house was too wet because it had rained the night before, so the kids rode mini go-karts instead.  They had a blast!  The mini golf course is one of the more inventive in the area, and there was a lot to do and see to keep a pack of small kids busy.  Will definitely be returning for more early fall fun!

Decent play place to spend a few hours. Not much of a wait while we were there. The only part i didn't care for is when there wasn't a line for an attraction the attendant went to the main check in and had to ask for someone. Good local place for kids.

name: Burden Iron Works Museum
address: 1 E Industrial Pkwy, Troy, NY 12180, USA
reviews: Exploring and enjoy sharing my adventures worthy place take children. When they think how boring life is and how more experience they learn and fun time.
Fascinating the building is nice with a good tour guide and artifacts
Call and set up a free tour! Sometime available same day. Great curator!

Went here for a quick visit after Google recommended it as something to do in Troy. And... It was awesome! The curator was extremely knowledgeable and even entertaining. There are lots of cool, old machines, bells, and other historical items, and even more to be learned of what defines Troy's significance in history.
Great place to visit. A small location but surprisingly large collection of historical artifacts with a very knowledgeable curator. Well worth the time to visit!

name: Opalka Gallery
address: 140 New Scotland Ave, Albany, NY 12208, USA
reviews: High quality exhibitions and public programs. And a wonderful community partner, hosting events and screenings for other Albany organizations. They have a terrific staff!
Lots of possibilities in presenting art are provided by this gallery.
Small and intimate place. Great acoustics.
They always have fabulous presentations.   You can go every couple of months and see something different.
There were many thought provoking pieces.

name: Crailo State Historic Site
reviews:
TODAY WE DIDN'T PLAN ON STOPPING AT THE CRAILO BUT WE GLAD WE DID. WE WAS THE SCHUYLER HOUSE FIRST AND THE TOUR GUIDE TO US WE COULD GET A PACKAGE PRICE IF WE WAS BOTH PLACES. SO WE GOT TO SEE BOTH HOUSE $14. $7 DOLLARS FOR EACH OF US TO 
 E TO GREAT HOMES. THATS A DEAL IF YOU ASK ME. THE TOUR GUIDE "SAM" WE EXCELLENT AND FRIENDLY. AND GAVE US A NICE HISTORY LESSON ON THE HOUSE ANDTHE COLONIAL DUTCH IN THE HUDSON VALLEY. THE HOUSE WAS BUILT IN 1702 AND HAD TWO OTHER ADDITION IN LATER YEARS. BUT THEY THINK THERE MIGHT BEEN ANOTHER BUILT HERE ON THIS SITE BECAUSE PARTS OF THE FOUNDATION WAS BUILT AROUND 1660.

This is a little known treasure about the first settlers of New Amsterdam and New Netherland. Rachel was a great guide and a plethora of information. I just learned that my paternal and maternal ancestors were original residents of this area. I will go back again soon.
Great little museum offering insights into the Dutch history in the upper Hudson valley.
Cool place! Wish there was an interactive aspect somewhere

Brilliant historians, beautiful place, engaging exhibits and artifacts. This is THE best exhibit for life during the time of New Amsterdam, as well as for learning about colonial slavery. Learned a lot about the founding of our nation's history here. Really smart people work there and are a great guide. I actually went back twice.

name: Falls View Park
address: 231-341 N Mohawk St, Cohoes, NY 12047, USA
reviews: Great views of the falls, but sometimes hard to find parking on nearby streets. Lots more water after the Erie Canal closes for navigation late each fall. Plenty of signage for the old Erie Canal nearby. It originally took 16 locks to get around Cohoes Falls and it took all day to go only a couple of miles. Great engineering feat and one of the last parts of the canal to be finished.

We have been chasing waterfalls for many years every area we visit we typically search for waterfalls in the area this was one we had been trying to get to for quite some time and glad we did! I thought it was a really great idea for all the life saving floats to be placed throughout the park I'm case of an accident you dont see that at too many parks. It was clean and it had multiple visitors in the hour we wandered around, great experience

We're fortunate to have such a beautiful waterfall so close to home. It is a quick stop, and a nice place to sit and enjoy the sound of the waterfall. Best time to visit is right after a rain or after the snow begins to melt.
Really beautiful spot. Easy to find and nearby parking. I'm happily surprised that there is not all sorts of touristy stuff for sale on the grounds. A few benches, but not much space for picnicking.

The park could really be amazing if worked on. The view of the waterfall looks small in pictures, its much bigger in reality, kinda surprising when you get to see it. The place looked like it was not taken care of. It's a very small park, you can't spend much time here, there really isn't anything to do. The main advantage of this park is the view, and it could really be amazing.

name: Thacher Park
address: 1 Hailes Cave Rd, Voorheesville, NY 12186, USA
reviews: Amazing place in great experience

We had some chicken BBQ; the area was super clean and quiet, we enjoyed the weather and little rain, restrooms 🚽 unbelievable clean, big thank you and great job to all employees and management.
😎😋

So many places to picnic and grill. There are covered pavilions. They are picnic tables and benches everywhere. Bring your own grill or use the ones in the park. Go to the Visitor's center for activities and sight seeing. 
Paid parking. $6 I believe.
Many trails.
No trash cans available. Take home whatever you bring. A family left a whole bag of trash at the park, and it was disgusting. Not much staff to pick up after people.
Visited this park on a weekday recently (mid october, 2018). It's a beautiful place with nice vistas of fall foliage. There's also a short hike to see a few waterfalls.
I, I think this is an excellent place for hiking and sightseeing

name: Ridgefield Park
reviews: I actually love this park. It's this intrusive Google thing I hate. Why would it want a review of a barren, snowy, cold park, almost totally unusable until maybe April? Obviously they want to take over our privacy and our lives so they can make as MUCH MONEY AS THEY CAN AT OUR EXPENSE.
My 2 sons enjoyed it and it was just a last minute thing to do.
Nice place to make party during summer
The park is my canvase.every day I come in to work I give everything I can to keep our Park safe and clean😀
Good memories with friends great place for reunions!!!

name: miSci - Museum of Innovation and Science
address: 15 Nott Terrace Heights, Schenectady, NY 12308, USA
reviews: This was a cool place to stop and learn about some Schenectady history with American locomotive as well and how old homes looked.  There is usually a Groupon which is 20 for a family of 4.  Electrical show was 4 per person and the planetarium was 6 per person.  Overall we had a good time.  It's not very big but there are a bunch of different shows for the planetarium and even a Nasa simulation area.

Such a great place for kids and adults to learn together! We went to see the toy exhibit, and enjoyed the collection immensely. The kids had a blast learning from all of the hands on science exhibits and we're excitedly talking about their favorite ones, and what they learned from each of them. It was a full parking lot when we got there but it never once felt overcrowded or chaotic inside. Great place for the family to enjoy an afternoon of fun education and new experiences, highly recommend!!

Having not been here in years MiSi is a great place to bring the kids. They offer a planetarium and different hands on activities for kids of all ages. I highly recommend this place for a rainy day or just for something different to do. The staff interacted great with the kids in my group.

This is an amazing place to explore different fields of study such as physics, geography and astronomy. Admission isn't very expensive and they sell a lot of useful things to have around the house. They accept both cash and card. You can learn about magnetism and surface tension here. It's excellent for kids and adults alike.

Nice history museum of electrical appliances with thought provoking exhibits on electric cars, renewable energy and the history of cooking appliances. 
The model train exhibit wasn't working when I visited.

name: St. Peter's Church
reviews: A gorgeous historic church that will take your breath away. The rector and associate priest are truly wonderful and caring people. The music is sublime. St. Peter's offers something a bit unique. In addition to regular Holy Communion, St. Peter's is one of the few Episcopal Churches in the area that does a traditional choral Morning Prayer service.
Amazing church in downtown Albany. A must see!
Warm, friendly people! Truly Godly worship!
My husband and I were married here. What fantastic historic architecture. A BEAUTIFUL church! Services are powerful and thought provoking. Congregation is warm and friendly.
Beautiful architecture

name: Central Park
reviews: Great place for the kids to play. It's clean, and fairly quiet today. Just enough kids to make playing fun.

Great place to head to for friends and family! From private trails and a beautifully groomed rose garden, this park has much to offer. 

•Ample parking🚗
•Wooded trails 🌲
•Playscapes for children
•Swimming & fishing areas 
•Dog Park 
•Tennis & Frisbee courts/courses 

DOWNFALL: the dog park 🐕 is in poor repair and is not managed well. Small and large dogs mingle together and often get into fights. Children run about the dogs and owners do not pick up after their pets. Use with extreme caution. Our dog has been known to be aggressive there as he gets overwhelmed even under close oversight. Best to go in the middle of the day as mornings and evenings are busiest.
Nice place for a walk. There's two ponds, a playground for toddlers and a much bigger one for older kids. There are also a number of baseball diamonds, tennis courts, and basketball courts.
Great place.  Hope to see additional improvements at Diamond A.  Plenty of potential to become a stand- out ball park.
A little run down but I do have some good memories there.

name: The Pine Hollow Arboretum
address: 34 Pine Hollow Rd, Slingerlands, NY 12159, USA
reviews: A hidden treasure. Visited on Sunday for the first time during the rain and it was beautiful and very peaceful.
Great collection of firs, spruces, pines, maples and larches. Trees trees beautiful trees!
I love this place, with magnolias in bloom now - don't wait
Quiet place to walk.  Need boots after snow or rain fall. A bit hilly for some.
It's a lovely place with a very friendly staff

name: Wacky Walks
reviews: I LOVED this experience.  I bought a groupon for Wacky Walks not really knowing what to expect.  It was amazingly fun and entertaining.  My husband loved it as well.  I highly recommend doing one of these walks.

name: Washington Park Lake House
address: Washington Park Rd, Albany, NY 12203, USA

name: Five Rivers Environmental Education Center
address: 56 Game Farm Rd, Delmar, NY 12054, USA
reviews: Cutting heritage trees for no reason! We took a walk this morning on the Vlomankill Trail and noticed a lot of random tree cutting was done recently, including some healthy 110 year old white pines. The cutting was done by contract because we saw the crew at work a few weeks ago but the workers were badly directed by the state. Healthy Ash and Hemlocks, well off the trail were clear cut while less healthy trees leaning over the trail were left in place. A bad job!
Great for a hike, a run or a visit of the museum. Great community and festivals. Nice views. Endless trails! Love it!

I recall coming here once as a child. There were some great nature trails to go on, and an owl to freak you out on the way out. You can expect to see lots of wildlife on the trails. Just don't touch the plants. Some of them are poisonous.
Would love to go back to walk the trails
This a beautiful place for anyone who enjoys learning about and experiencing nature.  The facility is modern and the trails are amazing.  The kids and parents will love it!

name: John Boyd Thacher State Park
address: 830 Thacher Park Rd, Voorheesville, NY 12186, USA
reviews: Thacher Park is a great place to hike, enjoy views of 2-3 states at once on clear days, take photos, and enjoy history both natural and human. My kids love the tall slide and climbing wall at the visitor center, and they can't get enough of the waterfalls. The stairs under the cliffs make for a quick and picturesque workout. Double back when you get back to the top instead of walking the flats back to your car if you want more cardio.

I went when some of the trails were closed, but the park was still enjoyable. I stopped at the overlook view and it was breathe taking! Plenty of parking spots and restrooms all throughout the park. Maps of the grounds are available at the visitors center.
Beautiful views. Nice location for a picnic. Tables, grills and restroom facilities are available on a first come basis.
Just love the view! Better to visit in summer as it’s pretty chilly up there.

Absolutely love this place. It has almost everything you need to have a great day. Hiking, recreation area, picnic tables. All it needs is a swimming area. If you want a day to just relax and enjoy the views, come here. If you want to get a workout and go rock climbing or hiking, come here. So worth the drive and the 6 dollars to park. Would recommend to anyone who is looking for a nature getaway.

name: Vischer Ferry Nature & Historic Preserve
reviews: First time there. Loved it. Still so much more exploring to do. Trails seem to average 0.9 to 3 miles but I'm sure you can loop certain ways to make it further.

Among the nature preserve areas in Clifton Park this appears to be the biggest. You can definitely get into some dense woods here along the Mohawk River. The variety of wildlife is great. Do watch out for marshy and muddy places—this is right along a major river after all.

Wasn't thrilled about this place. Lots of power lines along the main entrance and very swampy in the summer. There are also tons of bugs. We did the ferry loop and tall pines. Maybe there are some other good places but here the trails just kind of cut in and out with tons of trail heads for each of these tails. I guess if you live close by it isn't too bad but not worth a long drive to me. The pros are that they are protecting the land so that's good.

One or my favorite places to take a walk with my dog. Will also do some trail running in the summer when it's not so damp. The preserve offers a lot of trail space traveling through the woods.  You will definitely see a lot of birds and may see some other wildlife. The park borders the Mohawk river to one side and a section of the Erie canal on the other. If you like the outdoors and live in Clifton Park this place is a must visit. Very well maintained and clean. Sometimes it gets pretty busy with a lot of people, but only because it's so popular for fishing, dogs, and walking.
Enjoyable trails. Wish I used it more when I lived here

name: Friends of Peebles Island State Park
address: 1 Delaware Ave North, Cohoes, NY 12047, USA
reviews: Peebles Island State Park is perhaps that most beautiful of all the walking paths that I have visited in the immediate Capital Region. These pictures do not do the place justice; there is a pavilion that explains the history of the American Bald Eagle in the area, the path that goes along the periphery of the island is a good healthy walk that anyone can do, and the interior paths are beautiful, diverse, and you can even visit the site of a very old car wreck. If you are lucky, you might find a guide who will walk with you for a bit, and who can explain the island’s history, wildlife, and more.

Peebles Island is a great walk in the woods. And along the Mohawk and Hudson Rivers. It offers great views at every step. Offer a distant but unobstructed view of an Eagles nest on the far shore. This is the pair...one was hunting for food up River and around the bend.

Nice trails.  Restrooms still closed.  Is it to keep people from spreading the virus or just not season yet?   Trails are clean and walkable.  Saw deer and rabbits   Nice walk for kids since there is no school this week.

Great park, nice walkabout.  Great views everywhere. It is even bearable to hike around in December with mucky trails. Definitely worth a walk. Not strenuous in any way. See if you can find the abandoned car!
This is a fantastic spot. I have been exploring this park for the past few months and I still find it quite amazing. Cannot wait to start my longer walks when it gets warmer.

name: Emma Treadwell Thacher Ntr Ct
address: 87 Stan Levine Dr, Voorheesville, NY 12186, USA
reviews: Great education and trails.
lovely place, lots to learn!

A well maintained, low key education center with resources for all. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. There is a small shop with a good selection of local resources, books and souvenirs. They do a variety of community outreach activities including nature talks and bird watching, arts activities for kids, and art shows where community as artists can exhibit. They do a lot with relatively few resources, and are worth your visit and support.
Wonderful exhibits describe the natural habitat surrounding the center.
Great place for kids!

name: Prospect Park
address: 65 Prospect Park Rd, Troy, NY 12180, USA
reviews: It's a very pretty park. There are spots with tables for people sit and hangout. Since it is at the top of a hill, you can get a beautiful view of the downtown. You get see the sunset too!! Parking is free.

Neat little park, kept clean great view. People use it to smoke weed so it's kind of difficult to bring kids in certain areas...but hey do you. 

The four stars is simply because there is a HUGE cement old pool I'm assuming just rotting.

Lot of green vegetatation in the heart of Troy, NY. Children can play with equipments specially meant for them . The view of Troy City from the park is lovely. Lot of space for family and friends to spend time. Nice place for picnic also.

Large heavily used picnic park with grills and picnic tables. Water spray fountain for the kids. Pavilion for rent. Plenty of shade under trees.  Run down bathroom facilities. Road areas seriously in need of repair.  Horrific shame that large pool is empty, and neglected. This park could be a jewel. Wonderful sunset view from gazebo or bench at the top of the park.
Beautiful park close to downtown Troy. Good views of the city from the outlook. A little dirty, but well maintained. Good for dogs.

name: Schodack Island State Park
address: 1 Schodack Island Way, Schodack Landing, NY 12156, USA
reviews: Great camp ground and day use area. Rest rooms are clean. Campsites are large. Plenty of picnic tables in the day use area. Great kayaking (just keep an eye on the tides). Staff super nice.
Great place to go. My kids and I went on the trail for a small walk. Very nice place. Recommend it. Playground is great, pavilions. We have had Birthday parties there. I have seen weddings as well.

Nice NY state park and campground on the banks of the Hudson River. Clean, modern facilities and nice sites - many with electric. Boat launch and pavilion with playground for those of you with those interests.
Clean park and simple camping. Electric hookups available, water posts every few sites. Faces sunset over the Hudson. Great playground. Bunnies everywhere!

I have been to a bunch of NY State parks and let me tell you the facilities here are the beat I've ever encountered. The park is on the smaller side, but the restrooms and sites are very well kept. The firewood and ice delivery service is great! I would highly recommend. If you go here the best easy trail is hannahcroix preserve. It has a nice River for the dogs to play in.

name: Empire State Aerosciences Museum
address: 250 Rudy Chase Dr, Glenville, NY 12302, USA
reviews: Explored this aircraft museum while spending the weekend in downtown Schenectady to attend a wedding. Lots of historical artifacts and displays that cover the early aircraft industry in this part of NY plus the contributions of GE to jet and rocket engine development. Amazing collection of static display military jet aircraft including several types I’ve never seen before. Very enjoyable.

I love this museum.
There are many things to try here.
This place is good for toddlers 2years old and older.
I definitely recommend it .

Alot of amateur and not very well cared for displays and exhibits. Likely just from a lack of funding as it seems like a labor of love. Could use a good sponsor and a bunch of modernizing and someone familiar with the electronics that were already attempted to get them functioning. 

That said, it was an entertaining afternoon with my daughters, and no competition for time with the displays. Come give them some support!
Awesome museum..lots of history here, airplanes, model of an aircraft carrier, reasonable admission

Fun time for the whole family young and old. I brought my parents when they came to visit and they enjoyed it. The workers are very knowledgeable and helpful for the curios type. The kids also enjoyed climbing into the jets and learning the controls.

name: Indian Ladder Trail
address: John Boyd Thacher State Park, Voorheesville, NY 12186, USA
reviews: The trail is back open!  1.2 miles RT Just over an hour walk.  3 waterfalls, rock formations galore, ledges, and caves.  Park at new visitor center or at other end of trail in another lot.  Waterfalls were all active August 2, 2019.
Great option for a quick day trip, beautiful views. Visitor center was very impressive. Well kept, overall awesome experience!
Short hike with fantastic views. Will take about 15-20 minutes. Need to be able to walk steep stairs, slippery at times.

Beautiful views and incredible sights! However not for those afraid of heights or who are not sure-footed.   The state has added barriers on part of the trail and also added stairs and railings for the steep ascents and decent but it can still be a challenging trail depending on trail conditions.  Beautiful views of the Helderburgs, great waterfalls and caves to see along the way. Start at the new welcome center trailhead and do the whole Indian ladder trail. Then hike back along the ridge and see it from the top.

Beautiful views, easy hike. The area is great for a quick hike or a picnic, prefect to bring the family or go alone. Parking was $6 for the day. Only down side in my opinion is it gets very crowded and feels touristy.

name: Bethlehem Parks & Recreation
reviews: All the equipment is kept in excellent condition and there are many different activity areas for all ages. Everyone seems to be watching their children and are polite and respectful of others.

Little bit here for everyone, including people who do Pokemon.Check out the website.Not happy that they close the pool on Labor day.A lot of warm days in September that seniors could enjoy a more peaceful time poolside
A great place to spend family time. Clean, cared for and the kids have so much fun there
Great for many large events including grad parties, sports banquets, etc.
Great place to spend quality time.

name: Rivers Casino & Resort Schenectady
reviews: Last night I went to the casino to the Al B Sure concert with my sister and her husband and we had a fabulous time!!! Yes, we arrived early and stood in line just like many others! But I can assure you Al B Sure was definitely NOT lip sync any of his music!! This man is genuine and humble! Definitely not the same man back in the day! And his boy can sing!!!  And quite honestly who cares about the seats?! Who sat in them that long anyway?!   And please tell me what artist will go out of their way to talk with you to hear what you have to say and make sure every guest that came to see the show last night received a perfect long stemmed white rose. Al B Sure put on a wonderful show and I can only hope that the River Casino brings him back again!!!!💯

Beautiful casino, amazing rooms, great food.

Only gripe is the price of beer. As someone from Wisconsin, charging $4 for a PBR is kinda stretching it.

Otherwise had an amazing experience, staff is super friendly and helpful. If you are a smoker, the smokers lounge is very warm and bright with tons of space to sit.

Love this casino, Best one I have been to in New York. Every employee is very nice and always smiling. Went a total 7 times and had a nice relaxing time. I recommend going there to everyone I know. I won some and lost some, still love it!

River's Casino Resort has managed to ride the wave of growing pains to sustain itself in the gambling industry and stake it's claim in profits. With an adaptable business model no complaint seems to go unheard. This has more than assured that each time I returned to River's to gamble that I felt a bit better each time about my experiences. Professionalism is at the forefront of their operation, and diversity in their staff and it's services are continuing to improve.

Superbowl Suday was CRAZY!!!! Best place ever. Had an amazing experience. Casi was in our slot area. She was so nice an pretty brought our drinks out so fast!
We will definitely be returning! Hope to see Casi there again. 
Telling everyone to Check out RIVERS

name: Overlook Park
reviews: Beautiful, and add some history.
Nice view but far enough away it's not great. That park itself is not kept up at all.
Amazing point of Geographic and Geological structure in Mohawk river. Water flows over the huge rocks making a wondergul fall. Regarded by native people as the second Niagra Falls.
A great place to take photos you can see the falls great view
So breath taking

name: Henry Hudson Park
address: Barent Winne Rd, Selkirk, NY 12158, USA
reviews: There is a car top boat launch (canoe/kayak) and a regular boat launch, plus picnic areas,  covered pavilion, baseball field and bathrooms.  This is a beautiful part of the Hudson River to kayak on. The park is open from one hour prior to sunrise until 10:00PM. Google Maps doesn't have a way to state this opening/closing time for the park.

Boat launch open 24/7, park closes at dusk and is enforced by Bethlehem police  (no fishing allowed after dusk).  Kayak launch on the south end.  Trailer/ truck parking, handicapped parking, porta potties, plenty of picnic tables and space, grills, volleyball net, playground equipment.  A nice place to fish, launch your boat, or come with the family, but it tends to get crowded on weekends, holidays, and during striper season.
Such a quiet cute park. Great for a picnic. Calming with great views.
After Striper season, it calms.. This park is well maintained and offers much more than fishing from shore.
I love to hang out here and photograph the river

name: Grafton Lake State Park
address: 254 Grafton Lakes State Park Way, Grafton, NY 12082, USA
reviews: Good variety of well marked trails for all levels. New visitors center is a great place to check out, especially with the kiddos. Mountain biking is welcome on many trails and the Winterfest is a great event too. They have snowshoe rentals too so you can use this place year round.
Beautiful park, great trails. Can be quite busy during peak days but always a place to lay your towel and read. Or, of course, jump in the water to cool down!
The best! Great place for family’s to hang together. They have a beach and offer boats that you yourself can paddle along the river side. Beautiful views.
Great winter riding.  Depending on snow conditions, can be challenging but rewarding and fun trail system.
What a beautiful park! The lakes are gorgeous l, the views are great, and it's such a nice area. The only place within 2 and a half hours of me in nj! Too bad the ice fishing was not aiiight.

name: East Greenbush Town Park
address: Town Park Rd, East Greenbush, NY 12061, USA
reviews: Great spot for bringing our pup! We love the trails and the freedom we have when coming here to go on adventures! Highly recommended. They have a great new set up for a playground (in the warmer months) and a fence I dog park too!

This is a wonderful Park only a few miles from where I live it's very spacious and the dog loved it he got along with the other dogs very well and the people were very friendly the only drawback is that you have to pay a fee when other dog parks in the area don't I think we pay enough taxes in this town to cover that
Very nice quiet park even a dog section
Pretty nice park. Love the dog park dogs and their people but the town could do more to maintain the dog park.
Nice trails for walking the dog.

name: Saratoga Spa State Park
address: 19 Roosevelt Dr, Saratoga Springs, NY 12866, USA
reviews:
Saratoga State Park is one of the best parks in Saratoga. As a runner, it's easy to find various routes with tons of variety to keep you exercise interesting. As a photographer, my couples have always loved going to the park to take their engagement or family portraits. Since the grounds are so expansive, there is no shortage of beautiful places to shoot!

The park is dog-friendly, so there are always a few pups running around too in the spring and summertime, which I view as a great bonus!

This place is absolutely stunning! There are no words to describe the majestic experience! The park comes alive at night with a nightly colored carousel, beautiful fountains that are something that could come from a fairytale.  Saratoga in general is a beautiful place with some neat history!!!

Gorgeous state park with so much to do! My favorite activity is tasting all the different spring waters. Bring some clean, empty jugs to bring some home. Check out the Roosevelt baths it you've got $40 to spare on a bath. The naturally carbonated tubs are like soaking in warm champagne.

I had been here over ten years ago and only visited areas relevant to the venue at Saratoga, but even then the little I saw was so beautiful and very clean and we'll kept.  This past year I had the luxury of visiting Saratoga Park twice two nights for a concert l, in which you once see very little.  Then had an opportunity to visit a friend's family just south of the park and had a chance to see what else it had to offer, unfortunately this was near the end of fall not an ideal time but still very grateful I was able to see more of the beautifulness the park has to offer.

Saratoga Spa State Park is a beautiful place to relax. The gentle terrain offers picnic areas, shady stream side trails, suitable for the nature-lover or the casual walker, as well as certified running courses used by joggers. There are fountain springs all around the park. The fountains have signs that read that the water has medicinal benefits. I know people from all over the country to enjoy the benefits of the water. I did taste the water and some fountains had an effervescent taste to it while other had a refreshing taste. I highly recommend this park if you’ve never been before.

name: Palace Theatre
reviews: Went to see the Russian Nutcracker Ballet. It was my first time at the Palace. Ushers were wonderful, they helped  us find our seats.  Parking was a little tricky.  We have a handicap sticker and with valet parking we still walked a block and a half.  It felt like a mile but we made it. Beautiful  theater and wonderful show!

Beautiful,  clean,  comfortable seats,  need more bathrooms. Tons of us were literally running at intermission to get there. Smoke machine can be turned down as well for the stage,  almost couldn't see performers. Needs more options for non beer drinkers. Hard seltzers aren't for all.

The venue was absolutely beautiful inside and out. Great sound quality and the staff were so warm and welcoming! One of the ushers told us about other great places to go our the town and how much she loved working for this theater.
This theater is absolutely beautiful. A great place to see movies and concerts. Some people might not like seeing concerts with seating but I am not 18 anymore and I am all about the seated venues.
Beautiful historical venue! Not a bad seat in the house. Concerts, plays or films. Great local place with many different close-ish places to park for free.

name: Pursue the Clue
reviews: I’ve done escape rooms in Scranton PA, NJ, NYC, Troy NY and Albany NY. Having a lot of experience with escape rooms I was impressed with how elaborate and fun the room was! I went with escape room newbies and we all had a lot of fun and we ended up completing the escape room with just a few minutes to spare. We will definitely be returning!

This was our second annual trip to Pursue the Clue. We've now completed both McWhirley's Mystery and Captain Fermi's Spaceship. Both rooms were excellent and a lot of fun. Some great memories were made here and can't wait to come back again and try the other room!

We had a great time here on two different occasions in two very different rooms.  The level of help was just right, they didn't spoil it by too much help but  didn't let it get too frustrating on our own.   The workers were just great and the rooms were not just your run of the mill collection of puzzles but had a lot of thought put into them.

Man, I really wanted to like this escape room because I know the owner has built them himself, which I think is awesome. Unfortunately, this was probably the worst escape room I have ever done, and I have done around 50, including the ones in Crossgates mall and Enigmatic Escape in Troy (which is far better). 

We did McWhirely room. The flow of the room was awful-most of the clues we found were clues to solve puzzles that we had already solved. The person had to come in at the end to explain how many of the puzzles were meant to work- meaning that they did not work as they were supposed to for reasons that they were broken, or just not well designed. There were several things that just bothered me, demonstrating that almost no money is put back into maintaining the rooms. For example, the door is held together with an elastic band...why not just purchase a door hinge... This really impacted my perception of the room quality. For 26$ (including tax), I expect much better.

The escape room host was wonderful. But as someone who often does escape rooms, and while seeing the abundant of great reviews for this place , I felt I needed to say something. I think most of the people who view this as an excellent escape room experience have likely never done an escape room before.

Great atmosphere, perfect level of challenge making you feel accomplished for solving each clue along the way without "gimmes" that sometimes feel like a cheap excuse to progress you along. You interact with the room, and the props and puzzles perfectly fit the thematic of the room. The experience had me and my partner laughing and enjoying ourselves every step of the way. Will definitely be returning and strongly recommend you check it out if you're in the capital region and love escape/mystery rooms!

name: Crossgates Mall
address: 1 Crossgates Mall Rd, Albany, NY 12203, USA
reviews: Really nice and clean mall. Wish the food selection was a little different. Some nice sit down casual dining be nice. Unos sucks and Texas be Brazil is only open for dinner . couple other places offer appetizers and bar foods. This is a nice food court with decent selection of fast food . would definitely visit again .

I like that this mall is always adding new stores and attractions. Definitely has a lot more for kids than other malls as far as stuff to do. The food court isn't the best but there are plenty of restaurants to make up for that. Love the variety of stores and that the mall itself is well maintained.

I really like Crossgates Mall.
Most of the time I have to go to Best Buy. 
They have been getting more competitive price wise there. 
They finally started to bring PC parts back, but there accessories prices like cables and adapters are priced high. 
Every employee is always very polite and very helpful.

This mall is HUGE! We have been here a few times as a family and we enjoy the assortment of stores as well as the actual time we send here. The mall is much nicer than most malls, it's in good repair and has plenty of space to stop and look around at things without being trampled. They have benches in the center of the walk areas for those that need to stop and take a rest or those who just want to relax.

I went to funny bones to see a comedy show. The little part of the mall that I walk through was not that bad. On the way out I did stop at a jewelry store the people who are very nice even though they were getting ready to close they did allow us to stay and look everyone was quite polite and I didn't have any problem with any rowdy people overall it was a rather Pleasant night. The only thing was the parking. It was a cold night finding parking towards the door and then finding the actual place was hard when you've never been there because I don't do malls. If someone else were to come to the club that I'd want to see I would go again

name: Howe Cavern
address: 255 Discovery Dr, Howes Cave, NY 12092, USA
reviews: I think the tour was well worth the price. You spend a little over an hour down in the cave. It's in the middle of no where so if you think you are lost you are not just keep going. The only reason I did not give it a five star is because of the tour guides. They all use the same jokes and where a bit awkward.

Nice experience! This a place fully prepared for the tour. Very informative. 
In the summer and some holidays it can get very very busy, with long waiting lines. 
My kids love this place and the fudge. 
They have a nice gift shop, coffee shop and you can buy their cheese and fudge there.
** Go with a sweater or jacket, the temperature in the cavern is always 52 and you will need something.

I surprised my husband with a wknd getaway for Valentine’s Day and it was worth every penny! From beginning to end this place was amazing. Customer service was beyond what I expected (sry I’m a New Yorker) they were great! I purchased the culinary package and loved loved loved it! The cave tour was super near my husband loved it. The dinner at the American Hotel (comes with the culinary package ) was delicious !! The fudge selections were great and delicious , the Howe cave cheese was really good too. Please do not let the word “motel” fool you if your planning to stay the rooms are beautiful, clean, well maintained and the view from the lot is amazing. The beds were super comfy !  I will b returning in the summer with many more family members so they can experience the greatness this place has to offer.
Beautiful. You are not allowed to have purses, so be aware. Short boat ride. This is the first cave I have visited with a boat ride! Amazing views and knowledgable staff.
A little pricey for a family but a memorable trip. Tours seem to leave every 30 min tour guide was good. Photo they take in cave is only $10. Best bargin sovinior photo in all of our travels.

name: Bethlehem Town Family Dental
reviews:
I have gone to a lot of dentists, but never thought that they were present to the patient experience.
 At Bethlehem Town Family Dental, Dr Henry and his staff demonstrate exceptional service and take great care in understanding the experience of the patient, both from a health and consumer point of view. They have up to date and cutting edge technology and take great care in making you comfortable and at ease. There are no surprises and there is always a discussion about cost, insurance coverage and options. Of course I am partial to my hygienist, Nick, but all of the staff is warm, welcoming and take the time to make you feel right at home!  During my last visit, they accommodated me with great, conscientious care; I felt like I was at the Spa! Thank you Bethlehem Town Family Dentist!
K

Having gone to my 1st appointment on 10/18/19 I was able to meet some lovely ladies.  The Dentist met with me & thoroughly explained everything and told me how to go about things. They made me feel at home and I left very pleased. (I recommend BTFD to anyone that is looking for a new dentist) you will not regret it. When you’re received with a big welcoming smile it can’t get any better.
Great office and staff! The office is very accommodating to patient's needs and Nick the hygienist does a thorough job, would highly recommend!

Easily the best dentist I’ve been to.  Quick and professional.  Nick is a superstar technician and Dr Henry did some fillings that were virtually painless.

Def recommend.

Dr. Henry is awesome as well as his entire staff.  I switched to Bethlehem Town Family Dental when my previous dentist retired and was replaced with someone less knowledgeable and primarily focused on making money.  The technology is up to date and so far beyond what I was used to that I feel like I've had barbarians working on my teeth...up until now.  Such a great experience going here and I know Dr. Henry and his staff's primary focus is patient care and comfort.  I look forward to being a patient here for years to come.

name: The Saratoga Winery
reviews: Just stopped with sister Valentine's day and had a great time.  Tasted both beers and wines. And had a great meal. There was entertaining going on but we were in a area where we could still chat and hear what were saying to each other..... will be back....some of my friends will love it.
Wine and beer tasting is a great deal. Staff friendly nice spot to relax and grab a bite. Wines all very tasty. Would go back if in the area again.

Disappointing service 1/5 at best. Came here to see a band at 7, got here an hour early. The staff seemed to take care of guests only as an afterthought. 

They sold us a bar pretzel and charged our card
...only to inform us 20 minutes later that they haven't sold pretzels all day.

Very difficult to actually get the food we ordered, but what they actually brought was great once we got it.

Truly disappointed to see a place with so much potential fail so horribly at basic food service.

Gave this often ,too crowded place a 2nd chance and I am glad we did! On a Sunday it was busy but not crowded. Cute wine flights, decent beer flights. Nice live music. Not too loud. Gorgeous back deck and patio.

Have been multiple times and like it.  Very good food (wood fired pizza) they have some tasty wines (NY finger lakes grape sourcing).  Beer on tap.  We did have to wait too long for drinks considering the amount of bodies behind the bar.  Manager was on-point though and took care of everything but 20 minutes to order drinks with staff standing there.  Definitely recommend regardless, everyone was very nice.

name: Times Union Center
address: 51 S Pearl St, Albany, NY 12207, USA
reviews:
Decent size arena, not huge like the MSG in NYC.  We went to see a comedy show and had some nice floor seats.  We were able to see the comedians on stage and of course on the two screens.
The food and drink prices were ridiculously high for as lousy as they were, especially the popcorn.  The popcorn tasted like it was doused in salt.  For a 20oz bottle of water it cost $5.  We couldn't finish the popcorn because of how salty it was, and I certainly wasn't spending another $5 for a bottle of water.
The staff at the arena was nice and helpful with everyone especially when they were helping guests find their seats.

Love it. Need more parking spaces for visitors but the best safest place to go to see anything. I wish more NY city events took place in the Capitol. Because here is the safest. I send my 13, 14, 15, 16, 18 and 20  year olds alone. The police are outside and inside and who are very helpful and nice.

It's the only place to go for a big venue.  But it has great parking.  Great variety of food.  The seats need to be updated.  They don't provide good seating for larger people.  You must have a tiny butt to seat in any of there seats.  And they always over book there seats and you need to find a usher.  They always correct the problems.  And to many security officers that are want a bee cops that threat the paying customer like bubble gum on the bottom of there shoe.

Parking Garage Review - I've been using and parking at the Times Union Garage 4-5 days a week since July of 2013. I've been parking there for over 6 years as my work is very local. 

Today I arrived at 6:50AM to the lower entrance. Upper opens at 7AM. When I arrived the man at the both was having trouble with the PC and needed to restart. The screen was sideways (Ctrl+alt+direction will fix) after him trying for 10 minutes to enter his password and use the mouse sideways he gave up. During this time 6 cars were waiting behind me. My credit card machine is down, you'll have to leave.

Leave? I've been parking here for 6 years! I asked to speak to the manager, he said he was the Assistant Manager. Anytime this has happened in the past, they would let you through and I could pay on the way out. He started to get upset. They're not supposed to do that! Who were they, what booth, what did they look like.... He was far more concerned over them taking care of a customer than himself. 

He made me pull into the garage and turn around and leave...over $8 of which I paid roughly $10k in parking over 6 years at 4-5 times a week. I've paid every single time on the way out as well. 

He could care less. No one in his capacity should be management. Poor business decisions, and does not care for his customers.

Great venue for concerts -- we had the moderately priced seats and the sound and sight lines were good.  But on the return to the parking areas, the escalators should have been set to bring us up but they were not.  We had to climb innumerable stairs on the return trip.

name: Children's Museum at Saratoga
address: 69 Caroline St, Saratoga Springs, NY 12866, USA
reviews: Soooo fun! There was so much thought and research done into the education aspect. It was so clean and so exciting. We HIGHLY recommend

This place was absolutely awesome to take our kids. We were in town visiting family and had since time to kill. We could not have chosen a better place to let the kids get out some energy. Great place for them to use their creativity and cognitive skills.  Staff was super friendly and helpful.  Not sure if early Saturdays are normally slower but not a lot of traffic before Noon.

Totally worth it if you can get passes for free from the library. A little underwhelming if you had to pay full price. My 7 year old was just on the cusp of still finding it fun, but it was perfect for my 2 year old.
Totally terrific for kids! A kick for adults to watch kids enjoy!

I brought my 3 year old daughter here recently and we had a blast! The museum is housed in a large 2-story building, and there are so many hands-on and roleplaying activities available to engage young minds. Our favorite place to play was the pretend market/post office upstairs! There's also a pretend bank, schoolhouse, and diner--Seriously such a fun place where kids can spend hours roleplaying! They also have fun short workshops available at certain times that introduce scientific topics to the little ones. Overall you could spend hours in this place and still come back later and find something to do! We'll definitely be back!

name: The Hart-Cluett Mansion
reviews: It was a very nice experience with the historical memorabilias about "Uncle Sam" and the past history of the Troy city
Love thos place.  It is so pretty in December

One of Troy, New York's finest and most historical landmarks!! The architecture inside is truly one of a kind and the marble that is laid out, is also in itself, very historic and lovely! The house is open to the public the 2nd Saturday of the month at 2pm for a guided tour, May through December. Tours are also available by prior appointment. 2nd Saturday tours are $10.00 for adults. If you have some free time, don't pass the chance up to see this historic and beautiful attraction!! These guides really know their stuff and are very knowledgeable about the district of Troy as well! Snap some photos and you'll have them forever!! Don't miss this!
My family's favorite part of the RCHS Museum!
What a pity that I'd lived in Troy for years without a cluett all that this existed!

name: Albany Rural Cemetery
reviews: We visited President Chester A. Arthur's Memorial Tomb, located in Section 24, Lot 8 to pay our respects to our Nation's 21st President becoming President after James A. Garfield was assassinated. A man with a history filled life, we salute you. May you rest in peace
Beautiful and huge cemetery with lots of lovely quiet paths and trails. Best place for a quiet walk in the area.

Albany Rural Cemetery is a very peaceful place to visit. The cemetery is well cared for and amazingly they continuously in the process of repairing the deteriorating stones. Each season brings a special treat to those who visit with blooming flowers, birds, and trees in full dress. I n the Autumn the trees put on a show and decorate the tombstone in reds, yellows, oranges, and greens. In the winter everything is decorated in white. In the spring once again flower buds, green grass begins to cover the ground once again, bees begin to hum, and birds sing in the trees. Amongst death life abounds. If you get a chance, I would recommend stopping by the cemetery, take a walk around, read the tombstones, and visit the waterfalls and wooded trails.
