They would welcome donations, I am sure, to repair those civil war stones that have seen better days.

Very beautiful cemetery in menands ny that is the size of central park in manhattan as it will take you all day to see all the graves here.  There are multiple entrances and exits here, st agnes cemetery next door and a Jewish cemetery next door.  Heads up, a train crossing comes through here and it is active, the owner lives on site, menands police dept patrols here regularly, and do not come here after dark as it is easy to get lost, the police will arrest you if you are caught by them in the dark, coyotes in the woods and other wild animals, stay on the paths and roadways at all times, multiple roadways that have collapsed in this cemetery including a road in the middle ridge section next to the burden family vault, steep dropoffs here too!
Beautiful cemetery but they don’t keep up on the mowing anymore. I have to go over myself to cut the grass. They mow the entrance so it looks good from the road.  Very saf

name: Druthers Brewing Company
reviews: Reserved a table for 9 at the height of the dinner hour. We were seated and our drink order taken. With 3 children, our waitress Sheila was helpful and charming. With a variety of food and drink orders, we were served with a smile and promptness! Nice, comfortable home-brewing pub atmosphere. Reasonably priced, too.

Split two burgers with my buddy.  The Spicy Burger (pictured, right) was well-prepared, but didn't really have enough kick for my taste.  The Peanut Butter Burger (pictured, left), however, was excellent.  Truly unique and surprising.  Would order again.

This place had great beer and great burgers.  Angie was our server and provided us with the best of service!  She had a great personality and made sure we were always taken care of.  I would definitely come back here soon.

The food was really good. Beer cheese dip and the Pig Mac burger. There were 11 beers on tap and one in the bottle. Nothing really screamed that it was the best beer ever, but all of them were good. Service was tremendous. Very lively and fun atmosphere.

This was the first for us and it definitely won't be the last. Food is very delicious.  For our appetizer we got the pretzels and let me tell you.  They have to be the best around...amazing!  I got the chorizo chicken chili burger and I will definitely be back for that also.  My wife got the Druthers mac and cheese and that was also perfect.  Everything was perfectly cooked & seasoned.  The beer is tasty and fresh.  A must go in my book.  My sister doesn't drink so if you have the idea that it's a brewery I can't go there...YES you can and you'll be back.

name: 677 Prime
reviews: The food was absolutely amazing. This is going to sound crazy, but one of my favorite things was the bread, maybe because I had never tasted any bread like that before.. If you like steak, I highly recommend the cowboy steak. My husband got that and I got the strip, my steak was great, but his was even better, which I couldn't believe there was such a difference! I'm not sure of the exact differences in the cut, seasoning or cooking method, but wow! Don't get me wrong, my strip steak was great, but mmmm, that cowboy was something else. 🤣Our server Tim was phenomenal! 👏👏

5 stars. Thumbs Up! Great place. Times are tough for the restaurant industry right now. So many are working hard to offer take out and delivery services they don't normally have. It's my husband's birthday and I was looking for a special meal since our original plans fell through. He mentioned wanting a steak, so when I came across a special family deal 677 was running, I knew we had to try it. The deal included two 7oz steaks, shrimp scampi, lobster mac and cheese, asparagus, bread, and donut holes. They even included a bottle of their steak sauce and a gift card to use when they reopen. Everything was delicious! I loved the char on the steak. I'm so glad I found this deal and supported a local business during this tough time. We will definitely be returning to the restaurant when they reopen. Recommend Google!
Wow! Got the takeout curbside Prime Rib special. It was cooked just the way we asked with amazing seasonings. The roasted potatoes and carrots were delicious  too! A great value!

Absolutely wonderful place. A bit heavy on the wallet, but certainly worth the price if you're in the mood to splurge. The steak was wonderful, and I had a ribeye for two to myself (as well as a strip steak and a wee bit of A5 wagyu).

As amazing as the food is, the pleasantness of the staff is also of note. They were very nice and comforting. All around, this is by far the most wonderful place for a steak in the capital region.

Everything is always perfect from start to finish. The valet attendants are the nicest and upon walking in we are warmly welcomed by Jackie who always makes sure we are promptly seated somewhere comfortable. Our server Sergio is just fantastic--he is genuinely happy to be taking care of you and does a phenomenal job with absolutely everything.

name: The Hollow Bar + Kitchen
address: 79 N Pearl St, Albany, NY 12207, USA
reviews: Food was great! Came here for vegetarian options for a long overdue family gathering. Made reservations in advance was given two circle high top tables which were nice but not very conversation friendly especially since my grandmother was in attendance. This was also a dinner that had brought us together for the first time in a few years, that’s the only complain I have. Would have asked for another table but there wasn’t an open seat in the place. Great atmosphere , great food, would love to have given 5 stars but the seating thing really was a turn off especially because it was hard for my grandmother to get into the stools.
Great venue. The bar staff were awesome and the nachos were extremely good! Saw the band Magic Giant.... What an awesome and intimate setting!
Possibly the best wings I've had in a long time. Get the chipotle maple garlic wings! The pear and brie sandwich was creamy and fresh. Polite and friendly service. I'll definitely be back soon.

Very nice atmosphere and a place to be on a Saturday evening. Food was very delicious and the service was top notch. 

We were leaving when the live band was setting up and we could tell it will be an incredible night just by the few songs they  practiced  with.

When you first enter, it seems like another upscale restaurant/pub. You might not expect much but bar that serves some food on the side. That is not what the Hollow is. After you enter the bar and see the main restaurant area, you can follow the place further back into more restaurant seating and then a live band/ extra bar area. The place is nicely decorated, perfectly lit and you don't need to use your phones flashlight just to view the menu. When we entered, we informed the hostess that we had reservations for about an hour ahead and we'd just grab a drink first. The bartender was nice, friendly, and efficient. They had an extensive drink and beer menu with a good amount of local and others on tap. There was a show at the TU center so the place was a bit full. We didn't expect to be seated for a while but they sat us probably a half hour before our reservation which was really nice, especially for a show night. The tables were close but you didn't feel like you were on each other's laps. The noise level was fine for a full house. 
We ordered apps including muscles, soup, beer & cheddar dip, and a cheese board. It was all delicious. Our waiter gave good suggestions & he was very personable and attentive. They had a great menu, including several Veg & Vegan options which you don't find most places. After the apps, our meals didn't take long at all. They spaced it out like we requested which was nice because it can be a bit annoying when you  aren't even finished with the first few bites of your app and they bring out the entree. 
We ordered burgers, sandwiches and mac and cheese but I will definitely be back for the other selections like the ahi tuna, salmon, other cheese boards and scallops. If you like sweet potato fries, you must order them.
 I wish I hadn't waited so long to go here.

name: Yono's
reviews:
Yono’s Formal, You can listen to a wonderful piano player on Friday and Saturday nights.  I chose the five course traditional Indonesian Rijsttafel for dinner. Remind your date to get a appetizer or they will sit there envious, and hungry as you are served course after course of food. My food was cooked to perfection!  I have only positive things to say about all five courses!
Service was spectacular and the staff was well mannered and full of social niceties that many people and restaurants are lacking.

Yono's is, without a doubt, the finest dining in Albany. An establushed culinary attraction for over 40 years, still expanding the palette of patrons with each visit. My guest and I ordered the prix fixe, I the 4 course and guest the 5 course rijsttafel. We also took advantage of the wine pairings with each course. The meals were superb, the wines delightful discoveries, many from New York State, and the service was exemplary.

Pictures are the second course plates. Exquisitely prepared and presented.

Visit again and again!

Everything about this place is fancy. The food, service and ambiance. But it is very expensive. They have a small menu but all the items are very well thought out and delicious. They also have wine pairing if you want.  The menu changes very often and the food is always fresh. There isn't a good place to park for free so heads up. 

Worth a visit for a celebration or something but too expensive to go regularly.

Atmosphere just right with available seating on arrival... good timing during meal. Brett’s service excellent! Cream of asparagus soup very flavorful... with fabulous catch of the day Cod... bourbon pecan tart... with coffee piping hot... Loved it!!!
Really nice place for dinner, with a very, very extensive wine menu. Staff is really nice, and courteous. Clean, and relaxed atmosphere.

name: H&L On The Hudson
reviews: Best egg sandwich. Bacon egg n cheese. You get two eggs. Stopped here many times and always good. Prices are fair and worth what you pay for. Only open seasonal.
All most that time Monday morning opening day Everyone
Great  friendly place to grab some lunch! Excellent burgers and fries.Very clean and right on the Hudson River.. it's just a little ways past the U-Haul building in Albany.

The food is excellent, the people are friendly, helpful and provide great service.  The food is always fresh and made to order.  If you haven't tried it, you're missing out on a great breakfast or lunch.  The prices are reasonable and you get a lot of food for your money.  Try it, you'll really enjoy it.
Best place to eat in downtown Albany. Best service & friendly great atmosphere

name: Grappa '72
reviews: Truly outstanding Italian. A deep menu with all the favorites. The preparation is excellent. Service is good and the atmosphere is very nice. It is much nicer on the inside than it's strip Mall location would suggest. Parking is easy. They had live music the night I was there that was at just the right volume; a nice complement to conversation.

One of the best restaurants I have ever visited. We were travelling and came upon this gem on our way. The food was excellent, the service fantastic and we had the greatest time. We ordered various dishes and all were excellent. The desserts were to die for. We will miss this place.

The food was incredibly delicious. Everyone was very professional. They do not rush you, so if you’re on a date, that’s great. But if you’re looking for a quick meal, this isn’t the best choice. I would definitely return, but I’m giving 3 stars instead of 4 because we were sort of forgotten after our desserts were brought to us.

It is a small place with a lot of intimate areas. The menu is large and they have no issues with customizing your order. The portions are large and the food is very good. The eggplant parm is an appetizer and nicely done. They have a small area in the back with a large table for both groups. The place fills up fast. Even early so reservations are a must. The bathrooms are spacious and very clean.

We ordered takeout during the mandatory lock down and were anything but unsatisfied. For starters the bread was phenomenal, soft inside with a good amount of crust (the olive tapenade is delicious and that's coming from someone who doesn't like olives at all!) . We ordered the Mixed greens and Cesar salad and were blown away by how flavorful the dressings were. For our main course we ordered the Chicken Antica and the Mediterranean and were delighted by how savory the sauces were. Chicken was juicy and well prepared. Abundant amount of shrimp in the Mediterranean with an amazing sauce. Overall it was a great meal and we will definitely be ordering from them again and look forward to eating in the restaurant once that's a possibility again. Highly recommend!

name: Athos Restaurant
reviews: Absolutely delicious fresh food. From the lamb infused burgers with hints of garlic and onion, to the thinly sliced lamb on a Gluten Free pita, oregano fries, and oh those homemade Greek style chicken wings. Sheer heaven. Terry, barkeeper and host was amazing, sincere and eager to make your night spectacular!! This will be my "go to" spot. See you there!!

Wow, what an exceptional restaurant!  Aside from the wonderful service, the food was all delicious!  The hanger steak was exquisite, and all of the appetizers were very delicious!  Lovely calamari, very tasty hot feta dip, among other things like the eggplant appetizer.  Really wonderful desserts, including the baklava, lemon sorbet, which came out inside of a lemon (very classy), and really tasty rice pudding.  Great wines from red to white!  For a 5 person dinner we had the most wonderful 3 course dining experience and every penny was well worth it!  We will be back often!  The setting is also very classy with a great live music set up at the front of the restaurant.

Excellent Greek food. They cook to order so plan on a long enjoyable meal. Food is expensive but that is paying for quality and taste. Very good, even the simple things. 
My only complaint is how noisy it can be when they are close to full. The beautiful hardwood floors and wood work reflect all the sound.
Great place for dinner!! Food quality and presentation is fantastic!! We had the vegetarian platter and the our friends had the Octopus. Overall a terrific experience. It is pricey but all worth it

One of the best Greek restaurants I've been to. Service is outstanding. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Our food was served hot and fresh without a long delay. I highly recommend this restaurant if you are in the area.

name: Caffe Italia
reviews: This is the real-deal Italian restaurant. Small and  intimate makes it a great ‘date’ place as you can hear each other. It’s fantastic for a special celebrations too! Imagine Frank Sinatra, coming in from the back, to meet up with some pals. Can’t say enough about the food. Everything is fresh fresh fresh! Meatballs are my favorite. I’m hoping they’re open for takeout. Please try this delightful little culinary secret. I promise you’ll be back.... frequently.

Best Italian food in Albany. I went here for my birthday and had a great time. The atmosphere, food and dining experience make you feel like you are at a high end restaurant in New York city. The wait staff are amazing and really take care of you. The place is always full. You will leave satisfied.
This is an absolutely fabulous Italian restaurant!! The staff is wonderful and the food is delicious! When you go there for dinner, you're welcomed as family. Top notch, never disappoints!!
It was great . Went for my first time today. The  food was amazing and the staff was friendly and very informative.  Definitely on my list of places to dine now.

We fondly remember our first meals at Caffe Italia. They included a trip to the liquor store on Allen St. to get our wine, a polite and professional waiter, and a very impressive linguine with steamed clams and white sauce that had ample garlic. The classic pot of espresso, with a bottle of anisette placed on the table, accompanied their home made cannolis to finish our meal. Time passes, now a thorough brigade service anticipates your needs, artfully navigating through a packed house. Our evening's entrees; Veal Luciana, Seafood Primavera and, of course, linguine with steamed clams and white sauce, were delicious and substantial. Caffe Italia remains true to its traditional "Romeo Way", but we do miss the pot and bottle to finish the meal.

name: Café Capriccio
reviews: Came here when we stayed in Albany, they have great pasta and ravioli. The burrata ravioli was so good. My husband said this is the best Italian restaurant that he has never had. Leave some place for the dessert, it won’t disappoint you.
Unassuming, delicious Italian gem nestled Albany! The staff is tremendous, the dishes exceptional, the pricing... Leaves something to be desired. Will still definitely return!
We come here every year for Valentine's day, never disappoints! Cute romantic spot. Reservations are usually needed.

Albany is not short of it's fair share of amazing Italian Food. This place is spot on. Old school Italian style food, a little more traditional. Everything is prepared perfectly and the staff is amazing. Ownership really prides themselves on excellent quality

Excellent old world Italian. Perfect for a quiet night out with the better half. Area it is located is a bit sketchy but the restaurant is worth the issue. Staff is always very cool and knowledgeable.

name: Barcelona Restaurant-Wine Bar
reviews:
Nice cozy place with good food. 
Service is good if place not crowded. 
Beer selection really limited, no draft, bottles only. Wine selection much better. Need more visits, will return.

Great place in North Albany. The wait and bar staff were awesome, and the food was great as well. I went on a Wednesday night, and it was pretty full, which is a really good sign! If you like Spanish dishes and good Spanish wine, this place is great and off the radar.
Chicken paella was amazing and authentic. Fresh bread and olive oil delivered to table. Friendly and effective staff. Clean environment. Nice music.
Barcelona's is the best bang for the big in Albany. Reminded me of what good food is all about. This restaurant is clean, organized, and we'll serviced. Easily five stars.

What a delicious find in Albany!!  I stopped in this adorable place last week and had the best meal of my life!  What did I have you ask?  The chicken riccollano and it’s to die for!! Great food, great service and you too will be a regular after one try!!

name: Jack's Oyster House
reviews: Class act and old world. Like stepping back in time in a glamorous way!  I do not live in the Albany area anymore but I was looking forward to going to Jacks.  I was with my mother and mother in law who loves prime rib.  The reason we picked Jacks was because you can get a steak or lobster, etc.  We went for lunch and I was very disappointed in the very limited lunch menu.  We all found something on the menu to eat but there were no items on the lunch menu that would be the reason you would think of Jacks.  We had a nice meal but the lack of any steak and only one seafood entree on the lunch menu really missed the mark!  That's why only 4 stars.

Went for a special occasion. The service was excellent and so was the food. Got a free cheesecake that was amazing due to our celebration. Waiter also took our photo and gave us a nice Polaroid to take home. 

Worth the hype and the money.

One of the best restaurants in Albany, NY hands down! The staff is extremely helpful, friendly, and professional. I ordered the famous Nantucket Soup which is an appetizer. Once I tasted it I immediately wanted another one and knew I would be coming back here again! I also ordered the Crab Cakes from the lunch menu and my wife ordered the Black & Blue Burger. We were both blown away by the flavor and taste of the dishes. I have since gone back and had dinner there by myself because it was so good the first time! Highly recommended!
Amazing food & service!  Thomas and staff very attentive. Great ambience.
Jack's was wonderful. I had not been there in over 2 years. After a wonderful weekend this was the way it should end. Jason our waiter was great. Going back.

name: Kismet Mediterranean Grill
reviews: The food is nice, coupled with a beautiful ambiance. The service is also pretty good, they like to take care of their customers. The reason I am giving it four stars is, I felt the taste did not justify the price. However, I am not saying the food was bad, rather I expected a little more in terms of either the quality or quantity based on the price.

We moved to Albany from Texas like a year ago and since then we were looking for a nice Mediterranean restaurant like back in Texas. Finally we found it! Great food quality and rest and a really nice sitting environment.

A special place on Madison Ave's restaurant row. My first visit and I was impressed with the menu selection. We had an appetizer, main course and dessert, all met our expectations. Our server was knowledgeable and friendly.  I will definitely go again.

Give it a try....it is worth the visit.

Very clean and tidy, with pleasant decor.  Professional prompt service, good dolma.  Lighting is a bit harsh (I'm guessing either CFL or LED); softer incandescent bulbs would be a big improvement, maybe even candles.  Unique Turkish Coffee.
The restaurant has a great ambience. The food is delicious and has good aftertaste. The one thing to mention is smaller table size which makes it difficult to move dishes when you are with someone.

name: Cafe Madison
reviews: I went here with my parents and fiancée and we had a great breakfast experience. I absolutely loved their Vegan Breakfast Sandwich- delicious! I never thought I would enjoy a breakfast sandwich so much! The staff is also phenomenal.
Loved the quick service even though we came in at 2:30pm and they were about to close at 3:00. We were treated very fast and politely. Great atmosphere and good value for the portions they give you.

Super chill little pub cottage feel.  Food was amazing. Honest salmon omelette was delicious.  The bread is made in house and as thick as a mattress. Cold press coffee was better than cocaine. I just felt like the customer experience could’ve been a little better.  Very low energy,  staff might have been hung over
We got the Mediterranean Omelette and Stuffed French Toast. OMG it was amazing. The coffee was flavorful and the service was outstanding. The only down side... the wait. But absolutely worth it!

Really good brunch. We went here for a late Sunday brunch and sat outside. Our server was really kind and fast, and was sure to refill our drinks every time. The food was also really good. I got the berry & Brie crepes and my boyfriend got the eggs Benedict. They were all amazing!

name: The Cuckoo's Nest
reviews: Just had the family style roast chicken meal and could not be more impressed. The ordering process was so easy. The food was outstanding. I don't know what part was my favorite because it was all so amazing. You can tell how much effort they put into each and every meal. Will definitely be returning. Thank you for still serving during these times.

Such great food and an amazing staff.  My family and I have been going here for a little over a year and the food is consistently delicious.  We met the head chef and owner today, who were super welcoming and friendly.  The staff is super.  Great mix of savory and breakfast/sweet menu items...like chicken. And waffles.  Their French toast and home fries take it to the next level though!

We just ordered the family style fried chicken meal and holy smokes. First, the ordering process was fast and easy. I called around 1:25pm, and chose our pick up time for 5:30. At that time I walked in, my bag was labeled with my name, and boom. THE FOOD WAS AMAZING. The biscuits are so good; fried green tomatoes should be the title of a movie; and the fried chicken was superb. We’re so fortunate to have places like this, and even more proud that they are providing meals to hospitals, first responders, etc. “during these uncertain times” [btw thanks for your email every giant company I’ve ever thought of]. But seriously, order a meal from Cuckoos Nest, you’ll be pumped.

A cozy atmosphere hosts very good food and great cocktails. The crave chicken sandwich and grit tots are excellent. Our waiter Miles was very helpful in helping us choose what tot get. Will definitely eat here again next time we're in town.

May be the best southern cuisine in Albany (it's my first time here)... best chicken sandwich I've had in a while. Tasted the chicken entrees too but found it salty. Other than that the rest are good.  Stopped by in Albany on the way to VT. Tip: plenty of parking space right behind the restaurant.

name: Umana Restaurant & Wine Bar
reviews: Amazing brunch! Great flavors & drinks! I went out on a limb & ordered the Cool Mango Bloody Mary & am so glad I did. It was perfection! Might be my new favorite brunch drink as I find typical Bloody Mary's are usually overkill with the horseradish. The staff was so friendly. I really enjoyed the entire vibe of the space. We will definitely be back.

This place is very warm and inviting! Today they had a live band for their brunch and they were very good. This was also my first time and I will be going back. The staff were very friendly and my food was made promptly and was delicious.
Delicious international food!  The fish tacos were amazing.  The service is friendly and quick.

This place is the best! Really cool atmosphere, the friendliest staff, and AMAZING food. I had been meaning to make it for brunch for the Chicken and Red Velvet Waffles for a long time and they exceeded the hype!

I don't know where to start with this restaurant. We had such a pleasant experience. We were looking to host an intimate bachelorette evening and they delivered. They curated a beautiful wine tasting and menu that was absolutely amazing. We had the most such a great time and the food was great. Thank you for helping us make this day a special one.

name: Sweet Basil Thai Restaurant
reviews: Went there for lunch during quarantine. The cashew and mushroom entree and the mango curry were our favorites. Reasonably-priced, ready in 20 minutes. Very good, will return!
Absolutely incredible. The food was delicious, the atmosphere is great. Everyone is so sweet and kind. Definitely going to be coming back!
Some of the greatest Thai I've had in Albany, ordered green curry tofu and it was the most delicious tofu I've ever had!
This place was excellent, great food, nice presentation of the food, taste was great. Service was good and the place was clean. Going back.

Very busy on Sunday nights. The foods are really good. If you like Thai food , you will like this restaurant. Recommend the wings and curry rice. And the soup is very creamy and just like what I got in Thailand.

name: Tanpopo Ramen and Sake Bar
reviews: I love this place. My husband and I go often and we usually are able to sit in the same booth every time. Sometimes it gets crowded on a Friday night but that's to be expected. I enjoy the food, the atmosphere, the beer, and the service. We've brought friends and they loved it too.

Ramen was tasty but the conditions of the place are very old, dirty, and broken. It was hard to be there. Again. The soup was good. But I kept wondering about the conditions and couldn't help myself thinking about the germs in the kitchen and around us. Is the kitchen as dirty and greasy as everything around us? The bathrooms were ridiculously small. How can you (or waiters) clean yourself there?

Absolutely delicious! Seats are a little uncomfortable, hard solid wood booths or metal stools. I only mentioned because my husband has back issues and was ready to leave as soon as we finished. We've been looking for good Ramen closer to home and we certainly found it!

One of my Albany favorites! If you want authentic ramen in the Capital Region, this is the best place to go to in my mind. The atmosphere is very cool, despite the somewhat cramped dining area. If you don't mind being a little squished - when it's busy, that is - then you'll love it here!

Happened to come across this restaurant in an old industrial area that seems to be attempting a revival as a hip residential area. Small diner turned ramen noodle shop. And what an excellent job they did. The ramen is well done, both the noodle and the broth. Fellow diners said the pork dumpling was excellent, too.

name: The Paper Dragon
reviews: Excellent food and outstanding service!  My new favorite place in downtown Albany.  I appreciate the many vegetarian and vegan options! Gotta love the breakfast served all day too.

You DEFINITELY want to eat here. The food is out of this world. The chef is like a culinary Rick Sanchez pulling the best flavors from the food multiverse, taking your taste buds on the greatest thrill ride to euphoria!!!! Literally a party in my mouth and I look forward to eating here every time. The Asian fusion is done with perfect execution giving you a truly unique experience.
Food is great 🥯! Coffee is good (Chris's coffee)☕. The view is fantastic 🏙️. I love the little reggae dub playing in the background 💚. And the staff was nice and very attentive 👍.
Best vegan breakfast in the area. The owners are awesome. Highly reccomend! They have options for everyone and the food is amazing.

Love the diversity of their menu. It's a new age- ma & pa shop.  Breakfast (options available all day) and lunch options . Vegan, vegetarian and carnivore friendly! And there is more than just tofu and salads. Me and my friends have tried over half the menu and have not had one complaint. The bowls are a great size, definitely suggest if you are hungry! 
My friends love the Jax- typically sells out due to popularity. But the #1 for us all is the Garlic Potatoes!!
It's our favorite lunch spot. I cannot wait to see what else they created!

name: Provence Restaurant
address: Stuyvesant Plaza, 1475 Western Ave, Albany, NY 12203, USA
reviews: We celebrated the arrival of 2020 with lunch at Provence. Their seafood chowder and quiche Lorraine is to die for. We shared a bottle of wine and had dessert. We had a great time. Happy New Year!!
best place to have brunch with colleagues

Horrible food that was very overpriced. I had a lobster "bisque" that was little more than a flavorless broth with a cracker in it. The main course was a portion for a super model and was of similar quality. We had to wait almost an hour and a half  before we had our appetizer. I'm not sure what the issue was but the waitor blamed it on the kitchen and gave us a free bottle of champagne over it. Regardless it was clear that there was a serious lack of communication with the staff. I will never go back. Have never been more disappointed. 🙁
Excellent "French" cuisine adapted to local US tastes. I had the quiche and it was excellent. Excellent service, attentive but not bothersome. Nice ambiance.

Service ok. Temperature inside front room was, to say the least chilly. When we requested to be moved they said it wasn't possible even thought there were at least ten options in the back. And at least three still empty as we left. I don't think they took into account that the sub Arctic air blowing in every time front door opened. No fun had! Also food arrived warm not hot.

name: Wellington's
reviews: Couldn’t walk in because I didn’t know where the entrance was, called and was directed in through the hotel. Walked in and was sat immediately. Breakfast menu was simple and direct and the options just right, price was a bit high, but like the normal diner high. Everyone was nice and the atmosphere was pleasant. I got a window sofa chair type seat and the view outside was serene and calming. I ordered a egg Benedict and green tea. Food was good. It was also the only place open on Christmas and it was warm. Quick tip, your water glass smelled a bit funky 8/10
The food was amazing.  But best of all, our server Salvatore was the best ever. Very knowledgeable about the dishes and he explained everything very well. He is a great asset to your  stablishment.

Really nice venue, friendly staff and great bar service. Bartender Alanna, very prompt and attentive, politely and friendly - she's great at what she does. Enjoyed the drinks "Hip Hop Anonymous" was my favorite. Will definitely revisit.
Good food, good service. I get grilled salmon every time I go - it's delicious and I can't seem to cook salmon as well at home. (I try to only order things out that I don't cook at home.)

I highly recommend the weekend breakfast/brunch menu. Pancakes are amazing as well as the honey whipped butter. NY Benedict was worth the price in my opinion. Dinner is great for the most part. The best thing about this place for me is the Campfire in a Jar. It is one of the best desserts I've ever had. I love the modern interior and cool ambience.

name: ama cocina
reviews: Such a fun place with a great wait staff and so many options for food and drinks! Definitely would come back over and over to try more dishes! Would recommend the vegetarian pizza for an appetizer and trying a few cocktails!

Just alright.  Was excited to try this place, I've always heard good things.  Ambiance was cool, good location, fun menu.  Service was good and prices seemed fair.  Food was fine, but not great.  Pretty greasy, not much flavor (especially considering the creative menu), and didn't seem all that fresh.  Might give it another shot someday, but not going out of my way to do so.
Some the best Mexican food I have ever had in a very cool setting.  Underrated as a lunch place.  Be sure to make a reservation--especially if there is an event at the TU Center.

Nice food and not expensive. Try the chicken and tortilla soup, next soup I had in my life. When I finished mine I had to eat my friend's too. Cool decoration albeit not Mexican, and friendly staff. We were a group of 7 and we had a take booked online, however the place was half empty on s Fri night so I don't think reservations are needed.

Modern Mexican restaurant with hipster vibes in a nicely maintained and safe neighborhood. Very friendly staff who was very helpful to advise regarding gluten free options on the menu. Recommended to visit.

name: Van's
reviews: Great dinner, we both had a great overall experience, definitely a new favorite. We ordered the  summer rolls to start +  main courses. I ordered the Grilled marinated lemongrass chicken and Jon ordered the Grilled pork with the noodles.  We both had leftovers. Wine is inexpensive and affordable with your meal @ $6 a glass. The place was packed, with 15 out of the 20 tables filled and two waitresses + kitchen staff running around filling glasses and bussing tables.If you plan on visiting on a Saturday night, maybe call ahead because we arrived around 6 and it got super busy after us. Definitely a favorite restaurant for great Vietnamese.
Well done Vietnam foods. We had few kinds of pho and vege dishes. Vege dish was  very fresh and good. I like it! They put tofu in rice paper. Oxtail pho was really aresome. Deep broth make me happy.
I've been coming to Van's for the past 5+ years. Every time it does not disappoint. Real authentic Vietnamese cuisine and service is always fantastic.

Delicious food! The shrimp summer roll and the peanut sauce was nice, the Pho Ga was mild and flavourful. The boneless crispy duck was a surprise..the outer layer of spice was superb! The Vietnamese Hot coffee with condensed milk is a must try..overall good service!
I tried the crispy duck and it was really amazing and cooked perfectly. The spring rolls were also great. I can’t wait to go back and try more dishes.

name: dp An American Brasserie
reviews: I love love this restaurant. The food is delicious and fresh. The Indonesian noodles and short ribs are an must of you go.
Overall, everything was delicious and our server, Amanda R, was top notch.  Great selection of beverages.
Snooty waitress and the food was a poor value👎👎
Diverse menu, nice portion sizes and delicious food!
Everybody's food was great... our only disappointment was that they ran out of the desert special we all wanted to try... #greatfood

name: Navona
address: 289 New Scotland Ave, Albany, NY 12208, USA
reviews:
Delicious food! Tonight we had take out steak, their amazing bread and bottle of wine. Even in take out containers, the food was plated beautifully.  We are always greeted by their friendly staff and enjoy chatting with them. Food is always exceptional! Can't wait to get back to normal and sit at the bar.
Support this incredible restaurant now more than ever!

Nice atmosphere and interesting dishes from breakfast pizza to quinoa salad with salmon. I personally enjoyed the pulled pork sandwich. The place is good for a team lunch. The long table in the back can accommodate a dozen plus people in a quiet atmosphere. I enjoyed the place!

We usually go here for dinner but today we tried their lunch and it was ✨stellar✨. My husband got the pizza navona (margherita pizza essentially, fresh Italian style pizza made in a brick oven, best in Albany) like he usually does and I got their reasonably priced ($15) salmon. It was a proper portion which meant I was unable to overeat its deliciousness like my American nature wants to and FULL of flavor, the roasted asparagus, greens, and onion in the yogurt sauce was sooooooo good. We also got the chickpea panzanella side ($3, great price for a decent sized side that most places would charge $6 for) and were very pleased. I do wish they had pasta offerings for lunch besides a pasta salad, but I was not displeased with my options. I'll be back and I'm probably going to have to try their turkey pepperonata sandwich next. 🤤🥪👌

Great meals at a good price. Creative menu, from grilled cauliflower to steak. Pizza is amazing! creative soups, salads, excellent wine list, variety of brewed beverages, never got to dessert! Spacious and inviting light wood finished dining room, and dining porch in season. 

We will be back!
Went for Happy Hour,  appetizer and pizza specials.  I had the Mr. BILL Pizza.  Meatballs and Salami.  Delicious and only  $8.

name: Savoy Taproom
reviews: LOVE THIS PLACE!! Mostly on the first Sundays of the month when they have a mimosa bar. The mimosas are great, the prices are not too bad to be honest, and their breakfast items are BOMB! I recommend the Farmers breakfast.

Make your own mimosa (first Sunday of every month) is a must try! This just so happened to land on my 21st birthday and it was a great way to start the day. Food is reasonably priced for the high quality taste. I ordered the crème brûlée French toast and it was delicious!

Live music, old fashion cocktails 🍹 
Pretty good, some nice people around, people enjoying drinks and food, in general not bad, could be better.
😁
.
.
You're lucky, I saved this place for one if my faves.
See u soon

While the bartender was very pleasant, clearly the kitchen was attempting to pass along food very poorly prepared. My friend and I both ordered their $14 Reuben sandwich. Both came out burnt, with over done fries. Really disappointing since clearly they attempted to use some really nice ingredients. We had order at later point in the evening, and perhaps the cooks felt that we were the standard intoxicated crowd, given the large numbers of bars in the area, unable to tell the difference. However, we weren't and left disappointed. My best guess is the bartender felt a bit embarrassed about the food, as once it was laid in front of us, eye contact was not made again until it was time to pay. That being said, she listened to our displeasure at the meal professionally and completely. Perhaps, the only saving grace for this location.  The location itself is nicely decorated, however stay away from the restrooms if possible, as they have a very strong odor reminiscent of some dive bars with the ice filled urinals of old. All being said and done, this location left an actual bad taste in my mouth, and while I hope they begin to produce a product worth consuming, I won't be returning.

This is a place that many people bring up, but I feel disappointed for the price of the things on the menu and the level of satisfaction I felt.

I've come here twice, and feel I spent $30 for a $20 experience each time. It's not much money, but the disappointment stings. It's slightly above average food, presented well at a higher price point. But Applebee's is just as good.

The staff are nice enough. It's less loud than Lionheart which is about next door, and I feel has equivalent food, so it's a matter of preference. 

This is a decent enough place meet someone for a short bite, but I don't see any reason to go out of my way for what I get here.

name: Risotto
reviews: The bench seats see too low but the food was excellent. The fried cauliflower is indeed spicy. The bacon jam on the steak tips are awesome. Crab cakes are proper with more crab than cake. Everything that was in the seafood puttanesca was cooked to perfection. Based on all the other clear plates at the table, it's safe to say you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Get some.

Went for Brunch with a group of friends . Everyone loved it and we all look forward to going again!!! If you like waffles you must try a waffle dish. They look beautiful and fluffy and taste even better!
Delicious dinner and nice atmosphere. Staff was very friendly I'd definitely recommend. This place is near my house and this is my 1st time here I will be back. Worth every penny!

Went here for Valentines Day with my boyfriend. The staff was so friendly, the food was delicious, and the portions were decently sized. A garden salad and pita bread with oil came with both of our meals. We also ordered the crab cakes, which I highly recommend!
First timer. Wonderful presentations and the dishes had a delight "twist". Well prepared and delicious. Will definitely visit again.

name: Berben & Wolff's
reviews: This place is great. The food is not to costly and it taste awesome. The place does have sits and a bathroom but it is not very big. The staff is friendly and welcoming. When I come back to Albany this will be my first stop.

Walked in just after opening and was greeted right away. Had some awesome punk music jamming which I really enjoyed. This was my first all vegan meal and I gotta say it was wonderful! The sunflower burger filled me up and had a wonderful array of flavors.  Will definitely stop here again and highly reccomend to people

So amazing!!! Berben and Wolff’s is my favorite way to treat myself to a delicious vegan meal. All of the food is amazing. All the things I thought I couldn’t eat anymore since going vegan they have here.

I love the food, but the amount of waste is ridiculous. Have you guys heard of normal plates? Presentation is lacking. I'm dining in I don't want single use everything (besides forks, until they run out). Believe it or not a lot of people go vegan for the environment and your excessive use is really deterrent for those people. 
The side containers are recyclable but you provide no area to do so!
Very good quality vegan food. The coffee's great too. While you can have these anytime of the day, this is perfect for breakfasts. The ambience is wonderful!

name: The Point
reviews: The food was absolutely amazingly there. We were treated very well . service was pretty fast. Would definitely go again when I'm in that area
Amazing drinks and really comfortable atmosphere. Bartenders are great, especially Elaine!! Food is awesome (when made properly).
A popular place however  check the peak times  beforehand it gets really loud. And the cook burnt  my salmon and over cooked it. Drunks was good though.
Food was great. Nice ambience. Dining space was some what close knit. Finding a parking space was the only big problem at this location.

Top-notch food at fair prices. Spacious venue in prime location. Efficient service and clean bathrooms. Décor seems somewhat out of place. This place I discovered after attending Larry Sharpe's debate at the nearby College of Saint Rose.

name: El Loco Mexican Cafe
reviews: Best Mexican food in Albany! Great margaritas and friendly service. Prices are reasonable too.

I was in the mood for tacos and we stumbled across this place. It is a MUST visit. The food was so extra wonderful. I can't even wax poetic. I'm still coming down from the food high. My son had 3 tacos. My husband and I had shrimp fajitas. My husband also had the spinach and mushroom burrito. Delicious isn't a great enough word for the foods we ate.

Haven't really found a decent local food spot since I moved here 3 months ago. My girlfriend and I decided to try the place out. We ordered the loaded burrito and blue corn bread. Everything was delicious especially the blue corn bread. The employees were very helpful and nice as well.

One of the better places for Mexican food in the Capital District. The staff is great and the food is always fantastic. Quaint location and parking is good. I have been here 3 times and will definitely be back.

Friendly staff, walked my take out back to the Hilton where I was staying to enjoy it, but the restaurant wasn't too crowded, very nice atmosphere. Food was pretty darn good! A little pricier than expected but company paid so no complaints. I got the combo (taco, enchilada, and rice and beans) (beef)

name: Taiwan Noodle
reviews: Are inside late on a Friday night and it was empty. However, the service and food was still great. We had some dim sum and bubble tea, all pretty good. Neighborhood was a little sketch this late at night, but otherwise great experience.

Hello! 5 stars. Who would have thunk it, a great Taiwanese restaurant in middle of NY upstate.

Got soup dumplings and spicy sour steamed dumplings, both great.
Our group ordered house special soup (beef and pork chop) with thick noodles, mapo bean curd, beef and curry pot and fried chicken with fried rice.

We were not really hungry, but that changed when food arrived, we killed each dish. 
Very rare we order many and all turn out to be good.
Prices were fair too.
Will be back, highly recommended. Thanks.

Taiwan Noodle is absolutely amazing! The place may not look like much from outside but the food is tremendously delicious and authentic. The restaurant is clean and well organized. I will definitely be coming back often! Also the service was very good and all the workers friendly!

Homey Taiwanese food. Authentic, but nothing that will blow your mind. They’re consistent and the flavor is solid. Great type of food for a rainy Sunday afternoon. The minced meat and egg rice is the best, along with their beef noodle soup. The bamboo rice is lacking because the flavor from the meat failed to deep into the rice. This is the type of place for a quick meal and home style cooking. Reminded me of my times in Taiwan, but didn’t quite hit the mark.

Definitely would come back here for their dim sum! All of it was good and reasonably priced. The seafood casserole was filled with perfectly cooked seafood, but may not be everyone’s favorite dish. Their noodles were just fine.

name: New World Bistro Bar
reviews: Excellent cocktail. I recommend the Reticent Ryder. I had the grass fed steal with Brussels and chorizo  mashed potatoes. Delicious!

One of the best and most unique restaurants in the area.  Everything they serve is super flavorful.  They also have unique (and delicious cocktails).  My only knock is that there is limited parking and the lot is very, very tight.  Recommend parking on the street and taking the short walk.

Wish we lived closer to this great place. Perfect ambience, amazing service, delicious food. Truly a 5 star experience from start to finish. 
Amazing vegan options for apps, entrees and desserts... best vegan food in Albany!
Very good! Purple Haze Wings had a pretty decent bite, by resturaunt standards, but also good flavor. I had the Risotto,  and I was very happy. Service was very quick too.
Delicious food, friendly service and a classy atmosphere!

name: Mamoun's Restaurant
reviews: This may be some of the most delicious food I have ever put in my mouth! Charming little restaurant with tremendous service! Highly recommend!
Very friendly service, got exactly what we ordered. Food was great, nothing fancy, but very tasty and well-seasoned, not overpowering. And decent prices!

Best Falafel in Albany and some of the best I've ever had anywhere. Usually order take out but the dining room is cozy and full of charm. Service is always excellent as well. Definitely one of my top 5 favorite places to eat in the city.

Absolutely awesome food. The falafel were crisp and moist. Kabob plates were absolutely delicious. Zucchini app was super flavorful. Also don't forget the bakalva! So yummy. Everything we ate was better than the next. Delicious middle eastern cuisine!!

Food was excellent as always. Over the past 20 years Whenever I am visiting Albany I make it a point to stop there for dinner. Although the restaurant has changed hands-on number of time the quality of the food has not diminished. The owner of the restaurant was kind enough to take 25% off of our bill because we were having dinner 45 minutes before the sale price was slated to begin. Woul highly recommend

name: Salsa Latina
reviews:
Just spent $27 on online delivery before tax only for tmit to show up 20 minutes before the scheduled time. COLD. He had no change on him. 
My ENCHILADAS that are smothered in sauce and came with beans and rice did NOT HAVE ANY SILVERWARE. 
So now I'm out $40 and can't even eat this sub par food. 
No napkins either.  
Will not be ordering again.

Very flavorful and generous portions of food. Liliana our waitress was amazing! I had fish tacos and they came with refried beans, rice and corn tortillas. Very authentic and the music it's lovely. They had classics Latin artists. People are very nice and everything is clean and neat.
Seafood stew was great few weeks ago and last night the seafood platter was just delicious!!  Tostones are hot and crispy. Definitely go to Salsa Latina👍

Really like this place. Their food is really tasty, authentic, reasonably priced. Authentic Latin American food is difficult to find in the Capital District but you'll find it here. Atmosphere is nothing super-special but makes for a pleasant dining experience. Wait staff is really nice and helpful. A lock
Food was absolutely amazing, and the wait staff were great.

name: Crave
reviews: This burger was so amazing! Bacon cheeseburger, with pepper jack cheese & an egg on top! So flavorful and fresh. The fires portion could have been bigger. Price was accurate for the type of burger. When in Albany, I highly recommend this burger hot spot
Very good food. Nice atmosphere and great frozen yogurt

Good burgers. Meaty and saucy. Make sure you order french fries too!
Try a truffle one.

I had the loaded fries and black and blue burger, my boyfriend had cheese fries and the bacon cheese burger and my son had the crave cheese burger, the fries alone are enough to share with 3 people and the burgers are amazing! I highly recommend the loaded fries with avocado, banana peppers, scallions, tomato's and chives with a cheese sauce. We will be going again!
Great tasting burgers which are always cooked perfectly.  Staff is very friendly. Try the Crave sauce on your burger.  Worth the trip from anywhere.

name: Iron Gate Cafe
reviews: I use to come here every Sunday for breakfast because the food is always so incredible. Today I drove 4 hours just to have lunch here again. The have the best eggs Benedict I've ever had and they have multiple different combinations of it.  The have something for everyone here.  The food is localy produced (grown) and freshly made how you want it every time

Great food. Everything is organic from local vendors. They have good vegetarian options. The staff was very nice and I would come back for that reason alone. That plus the tasty food is a guarantee that I'll drop by next time I'm in town.

Everyone in Albany knows about the Iron gate. Food hack, get the pepper jack hollandaise as a side for your hash browns. You won’t regret it. 
John Denver is a go to. The cornbread pancakes are so good. They ever have some legit vegan options. Would go again, and again, and again, and again (and have). WORTH THE WAIT.

Beautiful courtyards and indoor seating in one of Albany's more astounding row homes make you feel like you're eating in luxury. Absolutely perfect place for Sunday brunch or everyday lunch. Food was well cooled and prepared. Wait staff were at exceptionally friendly and attentive. I don't know why I waited so long to try this absolute gem of an eatery.

Such a cute place with a great menu. Was in Clifton Park, NY for an event but drove to Albany for this unique restaurant with it's great offerings. Totally worth the drive, and enjoyed the beautiful buildings in this neighborhood. Friendly staff, and worth the wait to be seated during a busy morning brunch.

name: Rain Modern Chinese
reviews: This is such great place to have authentic real Chinese food. The quality is really great, the best pancakes and Peking duck. We drive one hour to Albany for the duck. And orders other stuff it is really good. The ingredients they chose is fresh and good quality and the way how they make the food just make ppl feel so great to eat and stomach really happy about it too
Delicious Gourmet Chinese food. Great customer service. Parking available in the back of the restaurant or on the street. This place is a go to when I’m in Albany.

Rain is the best Chinese in the city! Great service, full menu selection, slightly pricey but not so for what you get. And the food is FRESH! Everything from shrimp to chicken to vegetables is very fresh. Hot food comes hot and cold food is cold. Nothing on steam tables. 5 stars for me!!

This is my go-to Chinese place since moving to Albany and it's pretty solid each time. However, there are some things that bug me about this place which I want to note. I've only ordered take-out so I can't speak much about the service but the people at the counter are always professional and courteous. 
My main issue is with the dumplings and crab rangoons - there's too much filling. The pork dumplings taste like you're eating bacon with how much pork is packed in there. This may not be a bad thing to some people. Hell, you might actually look at it as a good thing which is understandable. But I like a good ratio between filling and the outer shell and Rain overdoes it on the filling.
Their hot and sour soup is also pretty weird. I ordered it once and there were very questionable pieces of meat in it. My guess is they re-purpose their burnt/unusable meat and put it in the hot and sour soup. I'd avoid it if I were you.
I recently ordered the wok seared salmon with garlic sauce and it was delicious. I'm a big fan of spice and this was super spicy. But...there was no warning of it being spicy (at least not on their online menu) so beware of surprises. I was kind of disappointed in the lack of vegetables as well. The description states "served with mixed vegetables" but all I received were mushrooms and onions. For the price, some zucchini or broccoli  would have been nice (asparagus is really good with salmon, just FYI).
Overall, Rain is probably the best you're gonna get in the area. Always consistent and the food (aside from the hot and sour soup) is fresh and cooked well.
Excellent authentic cuisine. We always get soup dumplings and salt and pepper calamari and it’s spot on every time. Definitely worth a stop in.

name: The Bishop
address: 90 N Pearl St, Albany, NY 12207, USA
reviews: Was my 1st time here. Service was very good. The server was polite and very helpful. The dining area was nice and clean. Very nice looking bar that you could sit at. The food was very good that I had. I had the smash burger. Others in the party said the food was very good as well. The Bish-up looked very good.

I was super excited to finally try The Bishop.  I was happy I read reviews before I made a reservation because previous reviews said that it took awhile to get food was very accurate.  And I would highly recommend reservations since this is a very small place.  My friend and I quickly put in our drink order in, but it took awhile to get our beers - I saw them sitting at the bar for a little while.  Both my friend and I ordered the french onion soup since we heard that it was pretty amazing.  I thought the soup was pretty good although my friend said that her soup wasn't really warm.  We had to wait about 30 minutes for the soup.  I also ordered the smash burger which was very disappointing.  The two patties weren't as smashed as one would expect and honestly, it was very bland, seemed to be no seasoning.  Also, our waiter never checked in on us the whole night.  I had to get his attention in order to get the check.  
The whole experience was a bit disappointing.  I did go on a night when there was a show at the TU so I can understand that service might not have been the best, so I would try the place again on maybe a quieter night.  However, there aren't many places to eat in downtown before a show so I feel like The Bishop still needs to deliver on quality.

The food was good and so was the customer service. It got pretty busy after my group walked in, and our waitress never forgot about us. We also needed menu modifications due to dietary restrictions and it wasn't a problem at all. I'll definitely go back next time I'm in the area.

Wonderful duck with brie and French fries cooked in duck fat. Have also had a great steak salad. Imaginative delicious food and great service. Love the view to outside. Also a fireplace. Highly recommended. Great addition to downtown.

Beautiful place! Decor is spectacular, the selection of whiskeys is impressive, they make great drinks and are super friendly. Recommend you check it out! I was there too late to try the food menu but plan on a return trip for sure.

name: Sukhothai
reviews: I had a very nice dining experience here. The strawberry shake pictured here was amazing. For my meal, I had the Horapa Rice plate which was delicious. I had such a hard time choosing what to get because so many items looked good! And being a vegetarian, I get very excited when I have so much to choose from- I need to go back to try more soon!
Really good food and killer Thai ice tea! Prices are good and the staff was very helpful and courteous. I highly recommend this place.

Great food for even greater prices. Lunch for two was about $26 after tax, before tip. The pineapple curry with chicken and shrimp was great. Accompany it with a miso soup. The soup is a good serving, better than some Asian restaurants.

The food is delicious. The portions are so large that even 2 people can share one order (or just take home). They have a rich menu, the prices and service are great. It's a very small restaurant, but has the traditional Thai food taste.

We try various Thai cuisine around the area as we really like it and my daughter in law, from Cambodia, says this is very close to her Khmer cuisine. This place wins, hands down, as our favorite. The dishes are generous, very flavorful and beautifully presented. Our group of 7 all had different dishes and everything was well prepared and our waitress was very attentive to our family. This restaurant is so worth it, despite looking for a parking spot in that are being a challenge!

name: Zi Jing Ge Restaurant(aka: Shining Rainbow)
reviews: From the outside, looks shabby but on inside is pretty nice. The food is great, and the only complaint that I have is the service. It wasn’t extremely slow, but it wasn’t fast. They also didn’t give/refill water if you didn’t ask. Overall, would recommend.
Gorgeous atmosphere friendly service beautiful decor furniture very nice place the food is delicious and I'll say it again the food is delicious

Great service, excellent ambiance. They have large menu to chose from, whether you like what you order depends on your taste. I liked the chicken fried rice, the fried pork dumplings, the shrimp dumplings, and the fried flounder fish. Kind of reminded me of the indo-chinese cuisine I am used to.
Excellent selection and service, and we visit frequently, so I'd say this is the norm. This should be on anyone's itinerary when visiting Albany. It is the best Chinese in the area, and farther.

One of the most talked about Chinese restaurant in the Capital Region is perhaps Zi Jing Ge, because compare to other Chinese restaurants around the area, this is one of the better ones. You can order lunch and dinner for under $10 and usually comes with a lot of food, which is something I like. For students, they get 10% of the bill, which is still better than nothing. The environment of this place is fantastic, and has a contemporary look to it with calligraphies hanging on the wall. I enjoyed their food even though it’s the typical Chinese food you find in other Chinese restaurants, but still, it was delicious. I would definitely order from here again.

name: The Standard
address: 1 Crossgates Mall Rd, Albany, NY 12203, USA
reviews:
Always enjoy coming to The Standard. Always greeted with a smile and the service is impeccable. 
The food is is always phenomenal. Never had a bad experience nor felt uncomfortable. If I could give The Standard more than gives stars I would. Looking for ward to another night out at The Standard.

Very much like a cheesecake factory but better.  The atmosphere and decor is  lovely and comfortable.  The drinks are great with a good variety of house mixers.  But that food!!!  About the most well rounded menu i have ever seen.  There is something there for everyone.  And its all fantastic.  I have been twice and could not find a thing to complain about.

The food was decent, service was good. But dining companion found a button in her food. It looked like a clean button, but still a button. They took her salad off of the bill. So again, the service was good. :) Will give it another shot.
New Years Eve dinner- 2020-Outstanding service.  Delicious food and drink  and dessert.  One of our favorites. Not rushed. Happy New Year! You won't want to miss out.  Get there this year.

I hate to write negative reviews but I was very disappointed with the shrimp scampi it was over cooked and just tasted off. I always order extra shrimp to every meal and I couldn’t even eat all of it. The pasta itself was amazing! The bread and butter was excellent as well lol. I would eat here again but never again will I try the shrimp.

name: LaZeez
reviews: Have eaten here a few times now and it is wonderful! Food is consistently fresh and delicious. They are quick with pick up orders too. Additionally, the customer service here is outstanding. They warmly greet you when you walk in and make you feel welcome. I would come back just for the customer service alone but it doesn’t hurt that the food is great as well!
Great food. Clean environment. Friendly service. Inexpensive. Love it. Will bring family and friends here.

LaZeez will always be my go to Indian spot ! 
They are always so kind and the food is always consistently delicious. 
I have moved to the Bethlehem area where there’s several Indian places close by and they don’t even come close to how good lazeez is ! 
Do yourself the favor and order from this place!
Always great food. Been coming here for 20 years. Our go-to spot.
The service was good and the food was also good but they had a very limited selection.

name: Nicole's
reviews:
Most often after watching a movie at the Spectrum Theater we have dinner at New World Bistro... One if my favorite restaurants.
Well we could not get in and decided to try Nicole's. To our surprise, we found the food to be pretty good. Everyone enjoyed there meals. We decided to eat there every other movie visit.
First visit here recently.  Quiet romantic atmosphere especially in the back.  Great meals,  we had veal and salmon.  Both were excellent as were our drinks and appetizers. Attentive service too.
Pretty good Italian spot. Didn't enjoy sitting in the back.

My daughters wedding was October 5, 2019 at Pat’s Barn. This place was the best. The food was fabulous and the wait staff was excellent, couldn’t ask for better. This kind of service and food is what made the even more special. Thank you all

Nicole's catered my niece's wedding this past weekend and the food was amazing! From the appetizers to the entrees and wine .... on point. The service was outstanding!  Sara in particular, was super helpful and gracious. I highly recommend Nicole's.

name: TapAsia Asian Tapas
reviews:
Best pad thai ever!!
It’s sweet and salt with just a bit spicy. with a top of peanut crunch, perfect!

I wish I could give some negative ratings to this place. I went there for lunch  with my friends and ordered drunken noodle with chicken. The food was good and tasty but you would not believe the amount they have given for one person. The quantity was much less compared to any similar kind of noodle plate I had in USA or Albany in any Thai place. 
But that's not the worst part. The worst part is when I asked politely about the amount, a woman(may be the head/manager) came shouting at me saying that's what they serve. 
Another of my friend ordered pineapple fried rice with no meat and it wasn't of less amount like mine.  
I have heard average reviews about this place so I went but it seems like it was my bad luck or may be they are the worst kind of people to run a restaurant and need to learn how to behave with customers.

(I wish I had the picture of pineapple fried rice or similar noodle from a different restaurant to compare)

Small but cute with a nice ambience. Menu has a nice selection of pan-Asian dishes. I ordered the salmon green curry and my husband got the pad thai. Both were excellent and well presented. Taking one star off as we asked for a spice level 7 and they turned it up to 11 🔥🔥🔥
Don’t order from here if you’re looking for pho. The broth taste like it’s just hot water and a beef bullion. The chicken yakisoba, Thai iced coffee and spring rolls were good though.

TapAsia was delicious and authentic thai resturant located on Lark Street ik m Albany, NY. I had the Aloha which was a scallop and Chicken dish seved in a half pineapple. It came in a few different levels of spice and flavor, i has hot thai. It was VERY SPICY but flavor was great and if you like a lot of heat. That be your dish. 

We had sticky rice and mango for desert. 

Everything was ok n ppint and waitstaff couldnt be friendlier. 

Atmosphere was trendy and warm. Very clean. We sat outside on the small patio.

A hidden gem.

name: Capital Q Smokehouse
reviews: Yall, my NC heart is soaring. I haven't had greens this good since I moved here.

Since it was my first time there I was offered samples of their three barbecue sauces. All of them had great flavor with good spice.

I went with the quarter okie chicken plate with cornbread, potato salad, and mac and cheese. The chicken was delicious and very moist. The cornbread had either maple in it or maple butter which was great. Mac and cheese is kind of what you would expect from a school room lunch but better. I didn't even have room to finish the salad. 

I'll definitely be back.

This is some of the best BBQ in the area and some of the best I’ve had. Staff is super friendly and food is always ready quick whether you’re getting delivery or pick up. 10/10 will definitely be going again

The wings were great, however almost everything else was a let down. If you're going to spend $85 on a couple of dishes you'd expect them to be good. The mac n cheese was super plain. The bacon mac n cheese had crumbs on top that were way over cooked and made the meal not a because they were all stuck together and very hard. The chicken sandwich and the pulled pork was good also the sauce is great quality its just the side dishes that need work.

I wanted one of everything. I was painting a house behind this place and all morning all I could smell was the smoker. I had to try it. It was amazing. If you have the opportunity, give this place a go, you won't be dissapointed.

name: La Serre
reviews: This was our first visit and we already know that we will be back. When we made our original reservation it was to use a Groupon but then found out that our reservation was for the first night of Albany's annual restaurant week. Dinner included an appetizer, entree and dessert for $25 per person. It was well worth it. We also ordered 2 different bottles of wine to accompany our meals off a nicely varied menu. Everything we had was well prepared, beautifully presented and delicious. We look forward to experiencing the full menu choices on our next visit. We do wish that the restaurant offered better parking options as they have no parking lot of their own and most parking options entail a significant walk to the restaurant which can be difficult for those with a disability.

LaSerre never disappoints! Our server, John, was knowledgeable, courteous and attentive without being obtrusive and the food is always phenomenal from appetizer through dessert! We will continue to return. If you have never been there, treat yourself; you will NOT be disappointed!

Tucked in the back streets off State St near the Times Union Center. The restaurant is nicely decorated with nice wood paneled walls, and dark mirrors, and a few wine bottles and wine glasses. It was dimly lit with a chandelier and some wall sconces. It could be a somewhat romantic setting, though the seating was fairly close to others. The atmosphere reminded me of a cross between a study in a fancy house, the kind that would have a leather arm chair, and a speak easy. However, something about the decor seemed like it was only 80% of the way there but lacked some finishing touches.

The waiter was attentive but without being annoying, he seemed to come around at just the right time. There were about three or four other groups dining at the time, but the place wasn't very large, so it was probably at least half full.

We ordered two martinis, one chocolate flavored and one that was more tropics themed. We then ordered off the restaurant week menus which are three course prix fix menus. For an appetizer I ordered fig caprese. It was good, though only a slight variation of a regular caprese as the fig taste wasn't too strong. The main course I choose the beef bourguignon and my girl got the mushroom ravioli. The bourguignon was a bit salty for my taste, though it tasted similar to many of the beef bourguignon I've had in the past. The ravioli tasted really good, had a very nice mushroom flavor without being overwhelming. There was two choices, a flourless chocolate cake and a lemon something (I kinda stopped listening after I heard chocolate). We both ended up getting the chocolate cake, which was so rich and thick it was like eating a creamier version of fudge. I didn't finish the cake as the sweetness was a bit overwhelming, though I did finish the other half later as a snack.

Overall it was a nice place, though it probably doesn't stand out on anyone's toes 10 list.
One of the best filets I’ve ever had! The restaurant and it’s ambience were perfect, service was excellent and the food was incredible. Couldn’t ask for more!

Food is really not fresh, made my stomach sick after coming home. I told the server the food isn’t fresh and he told me back “no other people said anything”. The food is also overpriced and really not worthy your money.

name: The Fountain
address: 283 New Scotland Ave, Albany, NY 12208, USA
reviews: My husband and I frequent the fountain, usually, late at night after we get off work. The food is good. Our server was great, very friendly and attentive.cThe nachos are amazing! My husband's pizza was good, he added meatballs and they were huge pieces. I love myself a good burger and went with the bacon cheese burger. I asked for it medium and unfortunately it looked more like well done.  It was a good burger, nice flavor, but would have been better if not cooked as much. We will be back!

Wonderful neighborhood bar and restaurant  that has a nice variety of items on the menu. My wife and I have been coming here for 24 years now and have never been disappointed by the food or the service.  The staff are always friendly and attentive,  and overall,  it's a place to go when you want good food and conversation.
If you've never been here before, stop in and be prepared for a nice experience.
Excellent pizza and wings.  Good deals on pitchers of beer.  If you're looking for a place to enjoy those three things, you won't do much better than this in Albany!  Highly recommend.
Great pizza! Go early, this place fills up fast at dinner time
We have been every pleased with our past several visits. The staff has been very friendly and efficient. Our meals have been very good. We look forward to returning.

name: Shining Rainbow
reviews: PURE AWESOMENESS!! This place is absolutely amazing and it has a karaoke bar that is pretty awesome in backand you can rent it out and have a party and simply by renting it out there is there amazing food included. They have real dim sum here which I have had to go to New York City to get up until now. Keep on doing what you're doing shining rainbow and keep up the good work

Very fine interior dining area and private party section. Large tables for large parties. Professional and attentive service. Enormous menu - Serving both authentic and Americanized Chinese cuisine. Quick serve times, hot pots, live fish, and alcohol available. Street parking only.
Great food! Great service! Such a quality, enjoyable place for dinner!
Did not expect it but I quite liked this place. The chicken curry fried rice and King's Spicy Chicken were really good. Also, the Red Bean Fried Ice Cream. And such a friendly staff..😊😊
Amazing fried lobster (remember to pay cash for discount!)

name: Dove + Deer
reviews:
Super good food and a wonderful staff. Amazing burger, and awesome location just a block away from the Capital building and LOB. They have amazing specials, and this seems like a place that has people working there who actually care about it 

I'm happy to pop in and spend my money. I'm a bit frugal, but the atmosphere and value I feel of the meal make it more than worth it for me.
Always awesome food and drinks! Highly recommended for others with celiac's disease! Menu always includes gluten free options and I've never gotten sick after eating there.

Really enjoyed the Fall menu. Started with a cocktail (Love on Dove) and it was really delicious. We ordered the wings for and appetizer and they were cooked perfect. For dinner I had the salmon and it was seared perfect and tender on the inside. Very good meal overall.

My husband and I have been coming here since inception and I feel the time is appropriate to leave a review. 
Sometimes we come just for drinks, other times we bring family and friends for a brunch or dinner. Consistently we were impressed with the quality of service but more importantly,  with the food they serve. I love when I find a place that understands the essence of food. It needs to engage the senses. The inviting aroma arising from an appealing plate arrangement calling you to take a bite. And when you taste it,  the richness and depth of flavor caresses your taste buds. That is exactly what I get in this restaurant and what brings me back. I find their prices reasonable as I usually end up paying more for the food of this quality.

I love a good neighborhood dive, but this is a pretty clear upgrade over Center St Pub.

Drink menu is well-priced — signature cocktails were all $10, every wine was $9 or less and beer was as it should be — and varied. Food menu was small but had variety.

Plenty of space, too. Huge bar, lots of tables and a more cozy area under the domed windows that remain from CSP. TVs and wooden/cork dartboards are here for anyone looking for activities while you drink.

My one (minor) complaint is you have to print the actual beer on a beer menu. Saying it’s a Jack’s Abby ‘seasonal lager’ or a Grimm ‘double IPA’ doesn’t really help.

name: Lost & Found Bar & Kitchen
reviews: Very cool downtown location with a unique American brunch menu. Service is wonderfully friendly and relaxed. Feels like a bar in your best friend's house.

I've been here a handful, or two, of times and they always deliver.  *Not actual delivery but more of a metaphorical "deliver". 

Brunch is always great, please order the 🥓

This bar is 100% a perfect neighborhood hangiut spot. A broad selection of beers, fruity to crisp, ipas to sours with ciders and a lovely cocktail menu. Not to mention their food. With a seasonal menu, with exciting and creative creations. This menu has me eating new things, and wanting to keep coming back for more.
Great food, fantastic beer and cocktail selection. The service was wonderful. Don't come here expecting just another burger and IPA. Lost & Found is more than that!

Amazing bar. First off the food is ridiculously good. It's a bar, who has good bar food... Well these guys do. So much so we can't wait to go back and try other options on their menu. Cool atmosphere as well. Every one seemed to have something they were doing while there. A family was playing cards a bunch of people were outside playing corn hole. Just blew me away, I work right down the street so I am excited to go back.

name: McGeary's
reviews: Welcoming attentive bartenders, wings to rival my favorites in Buffalo. Great beer selection.  Live music.

The service was fast and friendly. I ordered the sweet chili wings and they were really good. Others in my party ordered French onion soup, burgers, grilled cheese, etc and everyone was very satisfied with their choices.
Really great spot.  A true pub, with good beers and good food to match.  Tess and the staff are extremely friendly, and there is even some cool outdoor seating when its nice out.  Highly recommend!
Service was awesome, even though it was packed. Owner came out twice to chat! First trip to Albany! Definitely would return!
Food was delicious!  Band was great!  Service friendly and attentive even when it got busy.  One of our favorite places in Albany.

name: El Mariachi Restaurant
reviews: Love this place. Food is phenomenal. Staff is friendly and attentive. Clean tables, delicious food, great overall atmosphere. Has a few levels to the building which is kind of cool. Within walking distance to a lot of other Center Square establishments.

Not what I would call authentic Mexican food, but very good nonetheless. On street parking which can be limited and if you want to eat outside (which I totally recommend) then you should make a reservation. The place is always clean and my experience with the staff has been great. Delicious food and drinks, nice dining atmosphere and good prices. This is a great place to eat with family and friends.

Three of us went out to enjoy Mexican food before a show.  The food was delicious, the servings were generous and the service was attentive and pleasant.  Prices were reasonable and the decor was pleasant with a Mexican feel.
Very flavorful! Nothing frozen. All fresh. Good service and friendly staff.
Great food , good price!!! I really recommend this restaurant

name: Ocean Palace
reviews:
